author: luizarakaki

title: [refs] Ignore `:ident`s when comparing queries
body:
### Description

`query=` logic was returning false negatives when two queries were identical except for their `:ident`s.

This broke Metrics UI, for example, since it makes up a query based on the "old" and "new" metrics, and
compares those queries.

Now `:ident`s are ignored by `query=`, so two queries of the same shape are equal.

### How to verify

Try looking at a saved Metric. Previously, it always showed greyed out and with the "Play" button.
With this change, it works properly.

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: bshepherdson

title: [Cards in Dashboards] Edit dashboard save changes modal adjustments
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/51237

### Description

This PR polishes the "save changes" modal when creating a new question in a dashboard and updates the existing "discard changes" warning modal to match. Design can be found here: [Figma Link](https://www.figma.com/design/YzWNe48JlYGjhmFFtoAdTy/Questions-in-Dashboards---open-questions-answers?node-id=7-132&t=vCMTc9rDyyGS92cu-4).

As part of my solution, changing the confirm leave modal everywhere seems too high risk of a change for such a small ask of design. I instead chose to move the core logic in our `LeaveConfirmationModal` component into a hook which could be used by any ol' Mantine modal. This frees up folks to compose this hook with any modal to do whatever they'd like.

### How to verify

Save changes scenario
- Edit a dashboard w/ content
- Move an existing card
- Add a new dashboard question
- You should encounter the correct modal

Save changes scenario
- Edit a dashboard w/ content
- Move an existing card
- Try to go back in browser history
- You should encounter the correct modal

### Demo

![CleanShot 2024-12-16 at 13 28 01@2x](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7b1fd365-6585-432d-8ca4-11f7eb6ab6ef)

![CleanShot 2024-12-16 at 13 28 19@2x](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/958b2f0d-b66b-40fe-bb8b-6be549277cea)

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: fix(sdk): simplify font config by not providing sans-serif fallback
body:
We've had the `e2e/test-component/scenarios/embedding-sdk/styles-tests.cy.spec.tsx` suite flaky for a while, this PR should fix it.

I'm still not 100% sure of what's the root issue, I think it may be a race condition as we had a default font of `Lato, sans-serif` but when the settings loaded we changed it to `Lato`.
The weird thing is that the tests were looking for the former ðŸ™ƒ.

Because we fallback to the instance font anyway, which defaults to just `Lato`,  we can just remove the `, sans-serif` fallback and we should make the test more stable.
author: npretto
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Embedding', '')]

github-actions[bot] on (2024-12-16 15:28:35 UTC): <!---conventional commit reminder comment ID-->
@npretto You have modified embedding SDK code. Please make sure the PR title follows [Conventional Commits](https://www.conventionalcommits.org/en/v1.0.0/) style.
Here are all the supported types that will be shown in the changelog:
- `feat`
- `fix`
- `perf`

These types `docs`, `style`, `refactor`, `test`, `build`, and `ci` are also encouraged for non-changelog related tasks.

Please also make sure to include `sdk` scope, otherwise, the changelog will not include this task.

For example, these are valid PR titles:
- `feat(sdk): Add interactive dashboard component`
- `feat(sdk): Support theming pie chart`
- `fix(sdk): Fix static dashboard crash`

title: Implement new `EntityListLoader` that uses RTK Query hooks
body:
Closes #44492

### Description

Similar to #44523 but for lists.
For now it is enabled for databases only.

Pagination-related things (`paginationState` HOC + `page`, `pageSize`, `onChangeHasMorePages` props) were not migrated here - there is only 1 usage. It will be refactored [later](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/50324) when migrating the Users lists.

### How to verify

CI is green.
author: kamilmielnik

title: ci(sdk): add package.json to sdk exports block
body: Adds `"./package.json": "./package.json"` mapping to the `exports` block of the SDK. This helps module resolution to work better in cross-version end-to-end tests (based on @deniskaber's suggestions)

title: ci(sdk): fix and re-enable e2e workflow for 51 branch
body:
Fixes the e2e workflow for the 51 branch

## How to verify

- E2E was red without the webpack configuration, see this workflow run: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/12352781721/job/34471028626?pr=51327
- E2E is green now, see workflow runs in this commit (which forcibly runs the workflow against this branch): https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/51327/commits/19be57ec17575b4de7b533239bf62c0d7bd74ae8
author: heypoom

title: Remove unnecessary transaction around query analysis
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/51316

This should prevent deadlocks like we saw in the related issue.

title: chore: cleanup unused code
body:
> [!IMPORTANT]
> For those employed by Metabase: if you are merging into master, please add either a `backport` or a `no-backport` label to this PR. You will not be able to merge until you do this step. Refer to the section [Do I need to backport this PR?](https://www.notion.so/metabase/Metabase-Branching-Strategy-6eb577d5f61142aa960a626d6bbdfeb3?pvs=4#89f80d6f17714a0198aeb66c0efd1b71) in the Metabase Branching Strategy document for more details. If you're not employed by Metabase, this section does not apply to you, and the label will be taken care of by your reviewer.

> **Warning**
>
> If that is your first contribution to Metabase, please sign the [Contributor License Agreement](https://docs.google.com/a/metabase.com/forms/d/1oV38o7b9ONFSwuzwmERRMi9SYrhYeOrkbmNaq9pOJ_E/viewform) (unless it's a tiny documentation change). Also, if you're attempting to fix a translation issue, please submit your changes to our [POEditor project](https://poeditor.com/join/project/ynjQmwSsGh) instead of opening a PR.

Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/[issue_number]

### Description

Describe the overall approach and the problem being solved.

### How to verify

Describe the steps to verify that the changes are working as expected.

1. New question -> Sample Dataset -> ...
2. ...

### Demo

_Upload a demo video or before/after screenshots if sensible or remove the section_

### Checklist

- [ ] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Clean up `hasBeenReleased` checks
body:
Small follow up to https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/51184

### Description

To determine if a release has already happened, we don't need to check both enterprise and oss git tags anymore. This doesn't cause any bugs (since `hasBeenReleased()` always converts to the OSS tag name), but we should keep things tidy by removing these redundant checks.
author: iethree
labels: [('.Building & Releasing', ''), ('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: fix pie chart incorrect settings memoization
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/50381
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/50090

### Description

Due to the architecture of the viz settings code their computation there is no memoization for always computed values via `getValue` function. It led to this issue https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/48670 about laggin pie charts. The "pie.rows" value computation was memoized in the PR but due to the [incorrect judgement](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/48670/commits/5b73efa52fbeaf12f96e4e999ab6004431444943#r1802156429) about the memoization key the cache could return irrelevant `pie.rows` value from another card as `json_query`, `started_at` are not always present.

Reproduced with a unit test.

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: alxnddr
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/DashViz', 'Dashboard and Viz team')]

title: fix(View Details): calculate row after vertical and horizontal scroll
body: Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/51301 ### Description This problem appears when you first scroll vertically then horizontally, `ScrollSync` from `react-virtualized` triggers 2 scroll events (one for Header Grid and second for the main Grid) and one of events puts scrollTop (most likely header) as `undefined` since there is no way to scroll it. Because of that, consequence of vertical and horizontal scroll led to the wrong calculation of view details icon. ### How to verify 0. make browser to take half of the screen 1. New question -> feedback table -> visualize 2. scroll vertically by half a row, then horizontally, put a mouse over some line - view details view icon should appear 3. click on details view icon -> wrong line's data is shown in the modal ### Demo ### Before https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a16a316f-179b-4eff-aad1-27efa37d5fea ### After ### Checklist - [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR - [x] [stress test](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/12349334779/job/34459960701)

title: Adjust initialDashboardId calculation
body:
### Description
Adjusts whether or not we suggest a dashboard as a default location for saving a question. If the most recent thing you have picked in the entity picker is a dashboard, then we will suggest it. Otherwise, we use the existing logic for suggesting a collection

### How to verify
1. Create a question, and save it to a dashboard
2. Create another question and hit save, the dashboard should be suggested as a destination.
3. Instead of saving to the dashboard again, choose a collection and save
4. Now create a 3rd question and hit save, no dashboard should be suggested, and we should fall back to existing `initialCollectionId` logic

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: npfitz
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: fix(sdk): disable dashboard card click behavior and prevent url formatting
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/51099

### Description

Disables the dashboard card click behaviors by not invoking the URL action if we are in the embedding sdk environment. It also prevents URL formatting for columns with semantic type of URL. See [this thread](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C06FCQT0KMZ/p1733768624642749) for context.

### How to verify

Scenario 1: columns with custom destinations

- Create a dashboard card with "Go to a custom destination" click action
- Click on it in the embedding sdk
- Drill-through menu should not show up
- We should not be navigated to the custom destination, i.e. nothing should happen
- Links should be formatted as plain text

Scenario 2: columns of URL semantic type
- Create a dashboard card with the "URL" semantic type
- The column must not show be formatted as URL (anchor) when rendered in sdk's dashboard component

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR - E2E
author: heypoom
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Embedding', ''), ('Embedding/SDK', 'Embedding SDK for React')]

title: Fix actions loading
body:
### Description

Fixes loading of actions by using RTK Query directly.
Some parts of UI were sometimes (non-deterministically) left in forever-loading state.

Slack thread: https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C5XHN8GLW/p1734098690723919

Example failures:
- https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/12315673755/attempts/1?pr=51052
- https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/12317353716

### How to verify

Stress test: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/12349331735
author: kamilmielnik
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]

title: Use pr-str so log data is parseable
body:
Without the `pr-str` there is no quoting around string keys and values in the data structure, so we are unable to parse the logs for data analysis. I'm surprised the default printer is so broken.

Before (Grafana)

```
2024-12-13 10:17:00.306	
{"lvl":"DEBUG","lgr":"metabase.search.appdb.index","m":"Updated appdb search index state {pending-table search_index__3d6c4123_d5ed_49c3_9eda_98282210dffd, active-table search_index__3d6c4123_d5ed_49c3_9eda_98282210dffd, recent-versions [afc1963 08771ef], versions {08771ef {active-table search_index__a819ea52_3ef7_41a5_a598_4d08efa92325, pending-table nil}, afc1963 {pending-table search_index__64bc3ffe_7920_47c8_af59_b3c3de11a62c}}}"}
```

After (local)

```
2024-12-13 11:08:41,437 INFO appdb.index :: Updated appdb search index state fda7f617-52e3-443c-b9ab-5bf113780824 {"recent-versions" ["fda7f617-52e3-443c-b9ab-5bf113780824"]} {"active-table" "search_index__1a2e5b10_76df_4084_9797_373a5d5bb8de", "pending-table" nil}
```
author: crisptrutski
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

```
2024-12-13 11:12:31,961 INFO appdb.index :: Updated appdb search index state fda7f617-52e3-443c-b9ab-5bf113780824 {"recent-versions" ["fda7f617-52e3-443c-b9ab-5bf113780824"]} {"active-table" "search_index__ed825343_1d2f_4368_a1c9_8a68e39c72cd", "pending-table" nil}
```

I'm not sure why the behavior is different on the server side, and whether we could make this fix more generally.', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 12, 13, 11, 13, 38, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2541270195, 'issue_id': 2738147546, 'author': 'trunk-io[bot]', 'body': '<!-- Trunk Test Analytics -->

title: Include the card ID in field IDs generated for models
body:
This is to make the generated field IDs globally unambiguous. Model fields always get such a prefix, so a field ID like `field_280` is known to refer to a field of a table.

An example of a generated model field ID: `field_[card__137]_[:field "avg" {:base-type :type/Float}]`
author: metamben
labels: [('.Team/Querying', '')]

title: Replace :notification-subscription/external-email with raw-value
body: external-email is too specific for email, we can use raw-value which is generic and also can be used for other things such as slack channel

title: ci(sdk): embedding e2e workflow fixes for 52 branch
body:
Ensures both the SDK E2E cross-version test workflow and the SDK E2E workflow works in the 52 branch, by ensuring module resolution detects both installed npm packages in `node_module` for e2e cross-version tests, as well as for locally-built `resources/embedding-sdk` packages for regular sdk e2e workflow.

### How to verify

Check out commit [`c855640`'s checks](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/12350994209/job/34465409153?pr=51268) which modifies the workflow file to run against this branch.

You can see in the checks that both E2E and cross-version workflow passes using this module resolution method. Click on "Run details > Workflow file" in the above run to see how I made it run against this PR, you can do a search on "FIXME:" in the logs.
author: heypoom
labels: [('.Team/Embedding', ''), ('Embedding/SDK', 'Embedding SDK for React')]

title: [Notification] Send notification APIs
body:
Epic: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/50766
Add 2 apis:
- POST /api/notification/:id/send used to trigger sending a saved notification, can also take handler_ids list to selectively send to a list of handlers
- POST /api/notification/send used to trigger sending an unsaved notification

Note: we don't have permission checks yet, I'll revisit all the API permission model later, need to check with Product to set our permission model for notification.
author: qnkhuat
labels: [('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

author: dpsutton

title: guard against a stage number in matching
body:
old:

`{"category":["dimension",["field",5,{"base-type":"type/Integer"}]]}`

new:

`{"state":["dimension",["field",48,{"base-type":"type/Text"}],{"stage-number":0}]}`

```
(comment
  (let [login-attributes {"state" "CA"}
        field-ids #{55 46 54 48 50 56 51 47 57 45 53 52 49}
        attribute_remappings {"state" [:dimension
                                       [:field
                                        48
                                        {:base-type :type/Text}]
                                        ;; this stage-number is optional. Newer versions have it since https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/46914
                                       {:stage-number 0}]}]
    (into {} (for [[k v] attribute_remappings
                   ;; get attribute that map to fields of the same table
                   :when (contains? field-ids
                                    (lib.util.match/match-one v [:dimension [:field field-id _]] field-id))]
               {k (get login-attributes k)})))
  )
```
author: dpsutton

title: guard against a stage number in matching
body:
old:

`{"category":["dimension",["field",5,{"base-type":"type/Integer"}]]}`

new:

`{"state":["dimension",["field",48,{"base-type":"type/Text"}],{"stage-number":0}]}`

```
(comment
  (let [login-attributes {"state" "CA"}
        field-ids #{55 46 54 48 50 56 51 47 57 45 53 52 49}
        attribute_remappings {"state" [:dimension
                                       [:field
                                        48
                                        {:base-type :type/Text}]
                                        ;; this stage-number is optional. Newer versions have it since https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/46914
                                       {:stage-number 0}]}]
    (into {} (for [[k v] attribute_remappings
                   ;; get attribute that map to fields of the same table
                   :when (contains? field-ids
                                    (lib.util.match/match-one v [:dimension [:field field-id _]] field-id))]
               {k (get login-attributes k)})))
  )
```
author: dpsutton
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch')]

title: Dot X Releases
body:
[Document](https://www.notion.so/metabase/Dot-X-releases-13769354c90180239d37cd5c9ea87a46)

## Description

In order to make it easier to link to the latest version of a particular version, we're introducing "dot x" release tags that will be linked in release notes and announcements.

for example
```ts
51.0    ->  51.x
51.2    ->  51.x and 51.2.x
51.2.2  ->  51.x and 51.2.x
51.3    ->  51.x and 51.3.x
51.3.1  ->  51.x and 51.3.x
```

That way we can easily distribute an always up-to-date version, and do less frequent "official" releases and stop spamming people so much with version update notices.

Individual JARs will still be tagged with precise version numbers, and links will still exist for non-variable versions.

- [x] [ test minor](https://github.com/iethree/metabase/actions/runs/12379371642)
- [x] [test patch](https://github.com/iethree/metabase/actions/runs/12380340590)

title: Update underlying-records drill to use code in lib.drill-thru.common
body:
### Description

Some funcs were added to `lib.drill-thru.common` for the recent fix to the `zoom-in.timeseries` drill. Update the `underlying-records` drill to use the common lib code rather than duplicating it.

Relates to: #50556, #46932

### How to verify

Underlying records drill continues to work as before.

### Demo

### Checklist

- [ ] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: appleby
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]

title: Manual Backport: skip tracking non react-sdk x-metabase-clients
body:
Manual backport of #51179 to 51.

- Do not do promethus tracking for sdk.
- tracking ignores x-metabase-client headers when they're not == "embedding-sdk-react"
- remedy 24h query execution inaccuracy

title: [refs] Preserve `:ident`s in `replace-clause`
body:
### Description

`replace-clause` is for editing an existing clause, which should
*preserve* its identity. But the new clause was getting its own
random ident which didn't match the original.

I've added tests for this, and fixed the `lib.remove-replace` logic to
make them pass.

Hat tip to Mike for catching this case!

### How to verify

1. Create a query with clauses with random idents
    - expressions, aggregations, breakouts, joins
2. Execute the query and note the idents in the Network tab
3. Edit one or more of those clauses

On master, the edited clauses will get new idents generated.
With this change, they will correctly retain their original identity.

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Fix distribution drill thru for multi-stage queries
body:
### Description

Ensure the distribution drill thru is not returned by `available-drill-thrus` when a user clicks on an aggregation or breakout column, even if there are additional query stages after the last aggregation / breakout stage.

Relates to: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/46932

### How to verify

* New question: Orders
* summarize: Count by Created At: Month
* Add filter stage after summarize, e.g. Count > 1
* Visualize
* Select Table viz
* Click on the column header for either column
* "Distribution" drill through should not appear in the context menu
* Edit query to remove the summarize stage
* Visualize
* Click on any non-PK column header: drill should appear

### Demo


### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: [Cards in Dashboards] Update in-dashboard question creation flow
body:
Closes #51169

### Description

Implements updated design that moves the ability to create new questions on a dashboard into the question picker sidebar. Also fixes a mistake where we didn't take into account the user's permissions when showing the new buttons (thanks for catching @kdoh!).

### How to verify

1. Go to a dashboard and edit
2. Click the `+` button to add a new card
3. You will see buttons for "New question" and "New SQL query" (try each flow)
4. Sign in as a user who has no write permissions, see what only "New question" appears
5. 

### Demo

User with access demo (video)
https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7852426a-2956-46ce-a5b8-68140db2f4ed

User with query builder only access sees:
![CleanShot 2024-12-16 at 18 40 53@2x](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c4d045ae-6316-4fcb-a2bf-67fd78776adc)

User with no query permission access sees:
![CleanShot 2024-12-16 at 18 37 28@2x](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9257db61-927f-4cba-b2ef-e06d61bad9ef)

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: sloansparger
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: Add e2e tests for `if`
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/50698

Adds e2e tests that the new `if` function can be used in custom columns, filters, aggregations, both with strings and numbers.
author: ranquild

title: surface errors in move confirmation modal
body:
### Description

Small adjustment to allow API errors to be surfaced into the move confirmation modal. https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/51187 fixed the underlying problem of not passing along the required query param, but this addresses the fact that the API error was essentially swallowed and we never surfaced anything to the end user. We just closed the modal and pretended like nothing happened.

This PR also adds an e2e test testing the 

### How to verify

1. Go to a question that is in a collection, but appears in a dashboard
2. Attempt to move that question to a different dashboard
3. You'll need to induce an error for the update request, but click Move
4. The error should be presented in the confirmation modal

### Demo
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a37c511d-4b23-46f6-a493-c8ec6ac488da)

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: npfitz
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: Migrate actions menus to Mantine
body:
Part of https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/50766 ### Description This migrate action menus for Question and Dashboard to mantine. This is needed for further work on moving menu items between menus in later tasks. Reference design - https://www.figma.com/design/gj4D3g2P32nzNslR9sJSs8/Alerts-Redesign?node-id=912-48861&t=gmJHroxuwk7JasVx-4 ### How to verify Check dashboard and question menus. ### Demo
Before: After:
### Checklist - [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: deniskaber
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

title: Fix the inconsistency of card title length limit
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/49600

### Description
1. Add name length validation (under 100 characters) for question creation.
2. Add name length validation (under 100 characters) for  all card title editions.


### How to verify
1. Create a new question with a name length over 100.
2. Open an existing card (like a question or a dashboard) and rename the name at the top.

### Demo
<details>
<summary>Create a new question:</summary>

before:
![before](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3d1de4ed-bd86-4609-9fb1-c6e719292c13)

now:
![now](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6cf09daf-3572-423a-aac9-387903413781)

</details>

<details>
<summary>Rename a existing card:</summary>

before:
![before](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f0fde047-ada8-4c0c-857a-97a8e9d6a640)

now:
![now](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/228a0c27-244a-4ec7-8c37-c598895e6b7f)

</details>



### Checklist

- [ ] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: fix(sdk): wrap InteractiveDashboard with renderOnlyInSdkProvider
body:
A followup for https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/50736

The InteractiveDashboard code had hooks that were used outside of the PublicComponentWrapper, that was because it needed to customize some styles etc.

This PR adds `RenderOnlyInSdkProvider` and a`renderOnlyInSdkProvider` functions that help us add the "don't render outside of provider" logic more easily for cases when we need to separate the concerns of that logic and the one of styles.

To repro, you'd need to verify that the interactive dashboard page on the pages router (https://github.com/metabase/metabase-nextjs-sdk-embedding-sample) don't crash when you navigate to another page and then back at it.

Note that you'll probably need to cherry-pick https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/51071 to make it work as we renamed some things in master but not on the compat layer, and also the sample apps use the old naming

title: Fix the inconsistency of card title length limit
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/49600

### Description
1. Add name length validation (under 100 characters) for question creation.
2. Add name length validation (under 100 characters) for  all card title editions.


### How to verify
1. Create a new question with a name length over 100.
2. Open an existing card (like a question or a dashboard) and rename the name at the top.

### Demo
<details>
<summary>Create a new question:</summary>

before:
![before](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3d1de4ed-bd86-4609-9fb1-c6e719292c13)

now:
![now](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6cf09daf-3572-423a-aac9-387903413781)

</details>

<details>
<summary>Rename a existing card:</summary>

before:
![before](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f0fde047-ada8-4c0c-857a-97a8e9d6a640)

now:
![now](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/228a0c27-244a-4ec7-8c37-c598895e6b7f)

</details>



### Checklist

- [ ] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: givemesomefaces

title: feat(sdk): use rtk query for loading static questions
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/49620

### Description

Uses rtk-query hooks (e.g. `useGetCardQueryQuery`) to load static questions instead of calling methods in the `CardApi` object manually. There are two primary objectives for this:

1. Simplifies the logic of fetching static questions, and improve consistency with the rest of the codebase which uses rtk-query.
2. Handles request cancellation automatically, without needing to muck around with `AbortController`.

### How to verify

To verify that rtk-query correctly handles request cancellation using Shoppy:

- In your Metabase directory, build the SDK locally with `yarn build-embedding-sdk`
- In your Shoppy directory, link the locally built package and run the app with `rm -rf node_modules/.vite && rm -rf node_modules/@metabase/ && yarn add file:../metabase/resources/embedding-sdk && env NODE_OPTIONS=--max-old-space-size=7000 yarn dev`
  - Update the `file:` path in the above command to match your workspace's directory structure.
- Go to the Product List page (e.g. `http://localhost:3004/admin/products`) on the ProficiencyLabs theme, as that theme has a lot of products to test request cancellation
- On page load, you should now see 6 card requests ("/card/161") and 6 query requests because we uses an IntersectionObserver to only load the component that is rendered. Refer to the below screenshot.

![CleanShot 2568-01-16 at 18 38 01@2x](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c5a5af8a-249e-491a-80a3-269ab32067e3)

- Now scroll really fast to the end of the page, and immediately click on the other theme. You should now see a bunch of ongoing requests in the network tab with "X" on it, and a lot more new requests has been made. That means the requests from the previous theme has been cancelled, and more requests from the current theme has been issued.

![CleanShot 2568-01-16 at 18 39 33@2x](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ee248e22-78c3-4df0-b0cc-cfd4ea7bfabb)

To verify that StaticQuestion continues to work:

- Questions should continue to load
- SQL question parameters should continue to work
- Updating static visualization types (with `withChartTypeSelector` prop on `StaticQuestion`) should continue to work

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR - E2E
author: heypoom
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Embedding', ''), ('Embedding/SDK', 'Embedding SDK for React')]

title: Remove `entity.Loader`
body:
Closes #51213

### Description

Goodbye `entity.Loader`.
I left explanatory comments throughout the PR.

### How to verify

CI is green.

title: Remove the old `EntityObjectLoader` and clean up
body:
Closes #50322

### Description

Goodbye `EntityObjectLoader`.

### How to verify

CI is green.

title: add percentages to sankey tooltip
body: [Slack convo](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C064QMXEV9N/p1734361812223819?thread_ts=1734023496.547399&cid=C064QMXEV9N) ### Description Extends sankey tooltips with more data. Node tooltips show all output values with percentages. Edge tooltip show the the same information but highlight the edge value. ### How to verify - Create a Sankey chart - Hover nodes and edges - Ensure the tooltip show correct values ### Demo ### Checklist - [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Fix Liquibase CLI alias
body:
Fix the `clojure -M:liquibase` alias for running the Liquibase CLI, including handy commands like

```
clojure -M:liquibase dbDoc target/liquibase
```

to generate HTML documentation for the app DB (including info about the schema and which migrations affect which table)

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a6d35394-e651-47f5-9589-8ce495ad8ea9)

1. `dev.liquibase` needed to be updated to look at the new migration file(s) now that we have multiple
2. `dev.liquibase` needed to load `metabase.db` and friends so the custom migration classes were instantiated
3. `dev.liquibase` needed to set up the app DB (run migrations) before running `dbDoc`
4. Despite work to copy pasta the Java system property stuff in `metabase.task` into the custom migrations file, you still couldn't actually run custom migrations without loading `metabase.task` because the custom migrations file wasn't setting the connection provider -- only `metabase.task` did this. Rather than leave things broken I moved all the relevant bootstrap stuff into a new `metabase.task.bootstrap` namespace that both `metabase.task` and the custom migrations file can use. Not perfect but at least `metabase.db/setup-db!` now works without loading requiring `metabase.task` to be loaded beforehand
author: camsaul

title: [Cards in Dashboards] Bug fix - Query builder breaks with DQ in root collection as init value
body: ### Description Fixes a bug where the QuestionPicker breaks when its initial value is a dashboard question in a dashboard within the root collection. This generates a request to `/api/collection/NaN/items?models=collection&models=card&models=dashboard` and produces the following bug: ### How to verify - Create a dashboard in the root collection with a new dashboard question in it - Go to admin permissions and set the dashboard question as the source for sandboxing - Save then edit the sandboxing configuration - The error should now no longer be there ### Demo https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c71dad99-a139-4ac5-8788-3fab5b594f1b ### Checklist - [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: delete old dashcards when moving question from QB view
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/51150

### Description
Passes the `delete_old_dashcards` query param when moving a question into a dashboard from the Query Builder perspective. previously, after confirming that it was okay to remove a question from other dashboards that it appears in, we would not pass this prop and the update would fail. This works as expected in the other view, of moving questions in the collection view.

Also adds an additional test to ensure the that "It should still appear here" flow of dashboard -> collection works apropriately.

### How to verify

1. Go to a question that appears in a dashboard
2. Try to move it to another dashboard
3. On the confirmation screen, click confirm
4. There should be no API errors, and the question should be in it's new home, with appearances removed from other dashboards

### Demo
![chrome_jRBfmYakBx](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6c3859a0-a138-4027-a283-27b5f334274e)

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: npfitz
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: Don't compute a different hash key if they only differ on the order of values in a parameter
body:
Closes #48887

### Description

Updated `select-keys-for-hashing` to sort parameter values

### How to verify

Steps from the issue:

1. Create a question
2. Add it to a dashboard and link a category filter
3. Set caching policy for the dashboard: Duration: 1 hour
4. Select two values in the filter, e.g. 'Widget', 'Gizmo'
5. Check the logs, and note the question is being cached
6. Deselect the values
7. Select the same values again, but in a different order: 'Gizmo', 'Widget'
8. Check the logs and see a different cache key has been generated for the query
 

### Checklist

- [X] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: nvoxland

title: Just one Release
body:
### Description

For a long time, we've created separate github release for the open source and enterprise versions of metabase. This is spammy and unnecessary. This updates our release notes to simply link to builds of both the open source and enterprise versions. We simply use the open source version number for the git tag, since they're always on the same commit.

Note: possible error space for this is detecting the "next" release number for patches, as well as determining if a release has already been released. I have updated these functions to always explicitly use OSS version numbers

This also removes sha-256 checksums in preparation for https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/51257

### Checklist

- [x] fork test: [ci run](https://github.com/iethree/metabase/actions/runs/12301351756) | [release notes](https://github.com/iethree/metabase/releases/tag/v0.51.86)
- [x] another fork test: [ci run](https://github.com/iethree/metabase/actions/runs/12324212501) | [release notes](https://github.com/iethree/metabase/releases/tag/v0.51.86)

title: Partial rollback of FieldValuesWidget to v50
body:
Roll back the FieldValuesWidget to the state it was at on v50.

- Updates all the tests to use helpers that match the older input component.
- Makes one slight change to the component to allow it to render custom labels from the static list
- Add a giant test to make sure the correct component is rendered, just as it was in v50

Some open questions:
- The older component is not dark-mode safe. Is that a blocker or should we fix that?

[testing plan](https://www.notion.so/metabase/Testing-plan-Revert-FieldValuesWidget-to-v50-state-15969354c901804db53cdd1eddd9171e)

title: Fix autoplacement when a dashboard has empty tabs
body:
We were getting the `dashboard_tab_id` from the existing cards on the first tab... but if no such card exists (the first tab is empty) then we end up with a dashboard with tabs, but a card with `dashboard_tab_id=null`, which doesn't show up.

This also fixes a bug in the revision history: we were publishing an event for the dashboard being updated. The object was the updated dashboard, but it had the old dashcards that we'd hydrated in order to autoplace. We can dissoc the dashcards to ensure that the handler hydrates them with the fresh, updated dashcards.

title: update tracking for embedding-sdk-react and embedding-iframe x-metabase-clients
body:
- tracking ignores x-metabase-client headers when they're not == "embedding-sdk-react" or "embedding-iframe"
- adds tracking for "embeding-iframe" metabase clients
- remedy 24h query execution inaccuracy

Here are all the supported types that will be shown in the changelog:
- `feat`
- `fix`
- `perf`

These types `docs`, `style`, `refactor`, `test`, `build`, and `ci` are also encouraged for non-changelog related tasks.

Please also make sure to include `sdk` scope, otherwise, the changelog will not include this task.

- `feat(sdk): Add interactive dashboard component`

- `feat`

title: docs(sdk): document the compatibility layer for nextjs
body:
closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/50440

This PR adds documentation about the compatibility layer for nextjs, adds links to the sample apps, and also updates the suggested way of doing manual wrapping.

title: Fix Embedding SDK cross-version e2e tests for release 51 branch
body:
### Description

Fixes issues with Embedding SDK cross-version e2e tests for release 51 branch.

Issue happens because we cannot resolve `@metabase/embedding-sdk-react/package.json`, which is most likely happens because we added "exports" block to the `package.json`, and it takes priority.

We don't need version for e2e tests so we can remove it. 

Then , the second issue is that we checkout FE files to get stable set of tests and this overrides webpack config file. SO, I had to refactor this part to checkout only test files and helpers.
**This part should be backported to master and release 52.**, @heypoom 

### How to verify

CI should pass

### Demo

_Upload a demo video or before/after screenshots if sensible or remove the section_

### Checklist

- [ ] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: deniskaber
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Embedding', ''), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC'), ('Embedding/SDK', 'Embedding SDK for React')]

title: Convert ChartSettingInputNumeric to Mantine

The design slightly changes as we're moving to the new components but this change is expected if we want to use the mantine components Before After

The design slightly changes as we're moving to the new components but this change is expected if we want to use the mantine components Before After

title: Decouple styling from widgets
body:
Decouple styling from widgets

Start decoupling styling from widgets:

Add another thing to console.log

> [!IMPORTANT]
> For those employed by Metabase: if you are merging into master, please add either a `backport` or a `no-backport` label to this PR. You will not be able to merge until you do this step. Refer to the section [Do I need to backport this PR?](https://www.notion.so/metabase/Metabase-Branching-Strategy-6eb577d5f61142aa960a626d6bbdfeb3?pvs=4#89f80d6f17714a0198aeb66c0efd1b71) in the Metabase Branching Strategy document for more details. If you're not employed by Metabase, this section does not apply to you, and the label will be taken care of by your reviewer.

> **Warning**
>
> If that is your first contribution to Metabase, please sign the [Contributor License Agreement](https://docs.google.com/a/metabase.com/forms/d/1oV38o7b9ONFSwuzwmERRMi9SYrhYeOrkbmNaq9pOJ_E/viewform) (unless it's a tiny documentation change). Also, if you're attempting to fix a translation issue, please submit your changes to our [POEditor project](https://poeditor.com/join/project/ynjQmwSsGh) instead of opening a PR.

title: Lock revisions before adding more
author: johnswanson
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

  [![Static 'emotion-pojurp.e1ndma0u1' was expected to not exist in the DOM, but it was found continuously. | [Logs\xa0â†—ï¸Ž](https://app.trunk.io/metabase/flaky-tests/pr/51158?repo=metabase/metabase&commitHash=6354f7723956ee7f7e2063bd36d0823e895dd3fe&utm_source=gh-comment&runConclusion=FAILURE&runId=829f852e-a0b1-54a0-b521-df30292d9bcd) | [View Full Report â†—ï¸Ž](https://app.trunk.io/metabase/flaky-tests/pr/51158?repo=metabase/metabase&commitHash=6354f7723956ee7f7e2063bd36d0823e895dd3fe&utm_source=gh-comment) â‹… [Docs](https://docs.trunk.io/flaky-tests?utm_source=gh-comment) ", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 12, 11, 13, 43, 31, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2536228988, 'issue_id': 2732964165, 'author': 'noahmoss', 'body': "Your fix makes sense to me in isolation â€”\xa0but raises two questions for me: * Is there a way to rework the surrounding logic to avoid this issue? What if we get rid of `t2/define-after-insert`, and instead in `t2/define-before-insert` we just set `:most_recent false` for all existing rows for the model before we insert the new row? That would also create a predicate lock on the existing rows but avoid having this logic be spread across two different methods. * Why do we even need the `most_recent` flag instead of just going off of insertion timestamps or PK ordering? (I assume there's a reason that I'm not aware of, but maybe not)", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 12, 11, 14, 56, 54, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2536707819, 'issue_id': 2732964165, 'author': 'johnswanson', 'body': "> Is there a way to rework the surrounding logic to avoid this issue? What if we get rid of t2/define-after-insert, and instead in t2/define-before-insert we just set :most_recent false for all existing rows for the model before we insert the new row? That would also create a predicate lock on the existing rows but avoid having this logic be spread across two different methods. I don't think our transaction isolation level (I think `READ COMMITTED`?) is sufficient to make this work. Say we have one revision A, and are concurrently creating revisions B and C. - Revision B's transaction sees only revision A, sets it to `most_recent: false`, inserts a new row with `most_recent: true` - Revision C's transaction sees only revision A, sets it to `most_recent: false`, inserts a new row with `most_recent: true` I don't think we obtain a lock on revision A in either case? And testing it out, it does look like we end up with two `most_recent` revisions. > Why do we even need the most_recent flag instead of just going off of insertion timestamps or PK ordering? (I assume there's a reason that I'm not aware of, but maybe not) Good question. I think that would make more sense. Right now, we're doing a `JOIN` to `revision` in the collection items endpoint on `most_recent=true`. I think we'd need to instead `JOIN` to a subquery to make this work? But given our postmortem earlier, I'm kind of tempted to fix this with a smaller diff for now, and then maybe we can look at removing `most_recent` entirely in a followup?", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 12, 11, 17, 56, 29, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]

What if we get rid of `t2/define-after-insert`, and instead in `t2/define-before-insert` we just set `:most_recent false` for all existing rows for the model before we insert the new row? That would also create a predicate lock on the existing rows but avoid having this logic be spread across two different methods. * Why do we even need the `most_recent` flag instead of just going off of insertion timestamps or PK ordering? (I assume there's a reason that I'm not aware of, but maybe not) johnswanson (Issue Creator) on (2024-12-11 17:56:29 UTC): I don't think our transaction isolation level (I think `READ COMMITTED`?) is sufficient to make this work. Say we have one revision A, and are concurrently creating revisions B and C. - Revision B's transaction sees only revision A, sets it to `most_recent: false`, inserts a new row with `most_recent: true` - Revision C's transaction sees only revision A, sets it to `most_recent: false`, inserts a new row with `most_recent: true` I don't think we obtain a lock on revision A in either case? And testing it out, it does look like we end up with two `most_recent` revisions. Good question. I think that would make more sense. Right now, we're doing a `JOIN` to `revision` in the collection items endpoint on `most_recent=true`. I think we'd need to instead `JOIN` to a subquery to make this work? But given our postmortem earlier, I'm kind of tempted to fix this with a smaller diff for now, and then maybe we can look at removing `most_recent` entirely in a followup?

title: Fix ChartSettingsPopover style/z-index issues
body: Converts the `ChartSettingsWidgetPopover` component to ensure that styles are respected within the SDK. Nothing should change within the core app since chart settings aren't in a popover. Without this change, there's a few issues. When we put the `ChartSettingsWidget` and `ChartSettingWidgetPopover` directly into the SDK, the text styles aren't respected and end up being white text on a white background in the default theme. This is due to the TippyPopover causing issues with styling since it seems like the tippy popover is rendered outside the scope of our default styles, causing an effective style reset. So, there's two solutions here: 1. **Convert the TippyPopover to a Mantine popover.** The complication with this solution is that we haveÂ an `anchor` prop that needs to be in Mantine's `Popover.Target`, and we need to do some ref magic to ensure that Mantine recognizes the element that it should anchor the popover to. After trying to make this work with the `PopoverWithRef` that Nick created, we still couldn't get the popover to stay anchored with the `anchor` component. I went with the 2nd solution 2. **Convert the inner components to Mantine.** This proved to be an easier solution - I converted the text and tab components to Mantine components, which take the styles directly from the Mantine theme file. This proved to be a much easier solution that keeps the text and tab styles while keeping the paradigm of one popover for chart settings. We'll probably need to do something in the future to make our components and styles consistent, but this is a good stopgap for now. Before: After: **Testing** - In the core app, nothing should change. - Use `yarn storybook-embedding-sdk` and go to `QuestionSettings` and see that the text in the popover is black and actually stands out. Feel free to change the theme and see that the text is contrasted from the background Let me know if you feel that we need the padding around the tabs.

title: Ignore interpolated expressions in query analysis
body:
Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/51131

There are 3 layers of defense being added:

1. Macaw will [no longer](https://github.com/metabase/macaw/pull/115) return interpolated strings as identifiers.
2. We ensure that identifiers that are actually just super long are truncated.
3. If there is some unexpected exception, we catch it on the model hook path.

This will need to be backported twice, to 51

title: Add `in` and `notIn` custom expression functions
body: Epic https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/51134 How to verify: - New -> Question -> People - Filter -> Custom expression -> `in([Source], "Google", "Twitter")` -> Done - Visualize and make sure that results are correct - Notebook -> Click on the filter -> Make sure that the filter widget recognized the new expression shape - Update the filter, e.g. add `Organic` -> Click Update filter - Click on the new filter -> Back -> Custom expression -> Make sure the widget used `in` for multi-arg expression

title: [Cards in Dashboards] Fix bulk move runtime error
body:
### Description

Fixes this internal error: https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C0834B8DXKK/p1733867611819779

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a793ceaa-7c4e-4575-ace7-0c71af4eb046

### How to verify

- Create a dashboard, save to a collection
- Create a new question, save to the same collection (not the dashboard) and add it to the dashboard
- Create another collection, save it to the same collection, do not save to any dashboard in any way
- From the collection items view, bulk move both questions into the dashboard
- Should be successful now, but fail previously

### Demo

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/649be76a-0fda-4fa4-82e8-d388a2c925d3

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: sloansparger
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: [WIP] Mantine v7
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/45941

### Description

Updates us to Mantine v7!

Major changes
- move to CSS modules
- improved type accuracy for inputs
- more components
- more consistent apis, especially for flex components
- better RTL support
author: iethree
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team'), ('PR-Env', 'See https://www.notion.so/metabase/Ephemeral-PR-Environments-c74a3710c87a460dbf4fc0007a001458')]

[{'comment_id': 2533144643, 'issue_id': 2731391050, 'author': 'github-actions[bot]', 'body': ' @npfitz You have modified embedding SDK code. Please make sure the PR title follows [Conventional Commits](https://www.conventionalcommits.org/en/v1.0.0/) style. Here are all the supported types that will be shown in the changelog: - `feat` - `fix` - `perf` These types `docs`, `style`, `refactor`, `test`, `build`, and `ci` are also encouraged for non-changelog related tasks. Please also make sure to include `sdk` scope, otherwise, the changelog will not include this task. title: [Cards in Dashboards] Fix no items appearing in personal collection
body:
### Description

Bug flagged internally here: https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C064EB1UE5P/p1733864029661029
![Captura de ecraÌƒ 2024-12-10, aÌ€s 20 51 17](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/98e6e5a5-3ee7-438f-9df3-6e60ca73d59f)
It appears the issue only arises for users with a personal collection with no sub-collections but they have dashboards.

This PR adjusts our logic to account for dashboards being containers too and makes the query more efficient by not fetching any collection/dashboard data, just the number of items we have available.

### How to verify

1. Adjust your personal collection to have only one dashboard in it
2. Create a new question, open up the picker to save
3. Click on some other collection than your personal collection
4. Click on your personal collection from the root collections
5. You should see your dashboard now where you wouldn't before

### Demo

TODO

### Checklist

- [ ] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Quiet snowflake logging
body:
It looks like snowflake introduced some very noisy logging in their code.

https://github.com/snowflakedb/snowflake-jdbc/commit/9b7c9eb3e02c93cf7788c9866e1a483fe978e1be#diff-7859cac7243b3b9668df0770c96e264a1be2be06eefbbf7bba63904104028495L743

This should reduce the noise and allow our code to handle and log the exceptions.

Further context here:
https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C010L1Z4F9S/p1733861342280199

title: Implement cumulative aggregators in mongo
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/50832

### Description

Previously, cumulative aggregators were being done in clojure after the mongo query was finished.  However, this didn't work on multi-step queries where the cumulative aggregator wasn't the last step (for example, do a cumulative sum and then filter the result).  Implementing cumulative operators directly in mongo fixes this issue.

### How to verify

- Use a mongo db that is version 5 or later
- Create a question using cumulative sum or cumulative count
- Verify that the native query is using a $setWindowFields stage
- Add a filter stage after the cumulative sum/count
- Verify that the output is correct

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: wzimrin
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]

title: [refs] `lib.convert` preserves `:ident`s through a round trip
body:
This is the second edition of #50085, reverted by #51128. Closes #49682. Closes #49683.

Updates `lib.convert` and legacy MBQL normalization to allow
`:ident`s, and fixes some QP middleware and utils so they can
still match up refs correctly.

No user-visible impact.

Newly created queries will have `:ident`s generated for joins,
aggregations, etc. by the previous PR. This starts saving them
into appDBs. It is still acceptable to have missing idents at
this stage, including for new queries created without the lib.

Pre-existing clauses don't have refs added yet.

### Differences from the original PR

- Relaxed the schemas to make `:ident`s optional (on joins) and nullable (in `:aggregation-idents` et al).
- Now things work fine without idents, so the e2e tests are unchanged (and stats won't break)

### Contrib

* Fix loading in segments
    - Co-authored-by: Alexander Polyankin <alexander.polyankin@metabase.com>

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: bshepherdson

title: Allow config files to have literal values enclosed in {{{ ... }}}
body:
Closes #31562

### Description

Adds support to the config parser to use values surrounded by `{{{ ... }}}` as literals.

Whitespace around the value inside the brackets are trimmed for easier reading.

### How to verify

Create a config like in the issue, but surround the problem "password" value:

```
version: 1
config:
  users:
    - first_name: Luiz
      last_name: Arakaki
      password: {{{ MetaPa$$123{{> }}}
      email: luiz.arakaki@metabase.com
```


### Checklist

- [X] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Count and Categorize Public Views in query executions table (#51079)
body:
This is a manual backport (onto 51) for fixing how we calculate analytics for publicly executed queries. see: #51079

---------------------

* We need to look at the context field to categorize public views
* pull poll-unil into util ns
* fix comment typo
* add test
* update docstring
* remove true? call, it will return `true` on pass
* improve poll-until

title: add sdk theme selector to storybook + split the storybook sdk config into its own folder
body:
I saw a PR where we were adding a theme to a specific story, this PR adds a selector to all storybook stories and applies the theme to `CommonSdkStoryWrapper` so that it's automatically applied.

I also copied the themes from shoppy as sample themes, I commented the fonts because we don't have them on storybook now and I mainly wanted the colors


# Note: this PR splits out the sdk storybook config from the normal storybook

Loki was failing, I tried to rebase the branch for a week but it kept failing consistently on a story that wasn't even about the SDK.
As the only difference in the non-sdk code was technically a `export const globalTypes = {}`, I thought maybe the default value for that wasn't an empty object (??) so I tried to split out the storybook config for the sdk into its own folder and that seemed to have worked (see second commit).
Splitting the configs makes sense anyway as the more the sdk storybook is isolated and "clean" the more we can reproduce a real life scenario in it.


## Demo

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cd24a0b2-f378-40fb-b0d9-cde1ae43cd92

title: 50238 during
body: Epic https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/50238
author: ranquild
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]

title: [Notification] Send notification card
body:
Epic: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/50766

In previous PRs we added APIs for creating/updating notification card, but sending it was actually not working since the notification send and render code was still using the old pulse table.

This PR is the first step to make it work, it's not meant to be feature-complete. To make sure it's feature complete we need to convert all the tests in `metabase.pulse.send-test` to `metabase.notification.impl.card-test`, which I'll do in a follow up PR.

This PR will unblock me to write the `POST /api/notification/send` and `POST /api/notification/:id/send` which will unblock Denis too.
author: qnkhuat
labels: [('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

github-actions[bot] on (2024-12-10 14:49:31 UTC): <!---conventional commit reminder comment ID-->
@oisincoveney You have modified embedding SDK code. Please make sure the PR title follows [Conventional Commits](https://www.conventionalcommits.org/en/v1.0.0/) style.
Here are all the supported types that will be shown in the changelog:
- `feat`
- `fix`
- `perf`

These types `docs`, `style`, `refactor`, `test`, `build`, and `ci` are also encouraged for non-changelog related tasks.

Please also make sure to include `sdk` scope, otherwise, the changelog will not include this task.

For example, these are valid PR titles:
- `feat(sdk): Add interactive dashboard component`
- `feat(sdk): Support theming pie chart`
- `fix(sdk): Fix static dashboard crash`

title: Deprecate the openNativeEditor helper in favor of the startNewNativeQuestion helper
body: The pattern `openNativeEditor().type("select ...")` makes tests flaky. Let's use the new `startNewNativeQuestion` helper instead, which avoids the need to type.
author: rafpaf

title: Track which search models are affected by deletes
body:
For now, we've decided not to trigger index updates when elements are deleted, due to the overhead that toucan2 would add.

We have the code to calculate what *should* be done, so we might as well keep it around in a test that documents these relationships. 

It's good to be mindful of the implications, and we could even use this information to do manual calls from the relevant deletion call sites.
author: crisptrutski

title: Namespace native editor e2e helpers
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/51493

As part of https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/50249 we want to replace all native editor test helpers with namespaced alternatives which are more robust.
author: romeovs

title: Convert ChartsettingOrderedItems to match ChartSettingSelect
body:
Convert ChartsettingOrderedItems to match ChartSettingSelect

Use CSS module instead of styled item and start work on making sure it works in all of the contexts

> [!IMPORTANT]
> For those employed by Metabase: if you are merging into master, please add either a `backport` or a `no-backport` label to this PR. You will not be able to merge until you do this step. Refer to the section [Do I need to backport this PR?](https://www.notion.so/metabase/Metabase-Branching-Strategy-6eb577d5f61142aa960a626d6bbdfeb3?pvs=4#89f80d6f17714a0198aeb66c0efd1b71) in the Metabase Branching Strategy document for more details. If you're not employed by Metabase, this section does not apply to you, and the label will be taken care of by your reviewer.

> **Warning**
>
> If that is your first contribution to Metabase, please sign the [Contributor License Agreement](https://docs.google.com/a/metabase.com/forms/d/1oV38o7b9ONFSwuzwmERRMi9SYrhYeOrkbmNaq9pOJ_E/viewform) (unless it's a tiny documentation change). Also, if you're attempting to fix a translation issue, please submit your changes to our [POEditor project](https://poeditor.com/join/project/ynjQmwSsGh) instead of opening a PR.

Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/[issue_number]

### Description

Describe the overall approach and the problem being solved.

### How to verify

Describe the steps to verify that the changes are working as expected.

1. New question -> Sample Dataset -> ...
2. ...

### Demo

_Upload a demo video or before/after screenshots if sensible or remove the section_

### Checklist

- [ ] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Do not match inner clauses with -filter-parts
body:
Fixes a regression (master-only) introduced by new `-filter-parts` functions. They should not match inner clauses. This PR fixes the issue and adds tests.

How to verify:
- New -> Question -> Products
- Filter -> Custom expression -> `case([Price] > 50, 1, 2) = 1` -> Done
- Click on the newly added filter. It should not open a filter widget for `[Price] > 50` part.

title: [Cards in Dashboards] Reduce requests made for dashboards
body:
Related to #50173

### Description

Reduces the number of requests for a dashboard question's dashboard by using the `dashboard` property that is now populated on dashboard questions.

### How to verify

- Open the network tab in the browser developer tools
- Visit a dedicated dashboard question page
- See that there is no longer a request for the dashboard the question is contained in

### Demo

Before

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b765038f-ab80-4801-9680-73841b763078

After

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b2845985-b07b-46ec-bc56-3a03f7a6d80d


### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Count and Categorize Public Views in query executions table
body:
We need to look at the context field to categorize public views. This has the fix, and tests to make sure we are counting public card views.

The test is a little tricky because the tabulation of query executions is asyncronous, so we poll in the test for maximum of 300ms.

title: fix flaky webhook test
body:
> [!IMPORTANT]
> For those employed by Metabase: if you are merging into master, please add either a `backport` or a `no-backport` label to this PR. You will not be able to merge until you do this step. Refer to the section [Do I need to backport this PR?](https://www.notion.so/metabase/Metabase-Branching-Strategy-6eb577d5f61142aa960a626d6bbdfeb3?pvs=4#89f80d6f17714a0198aeb66c0efd1b71) in the Metabase Branching Strategy document for more details. If you're not employed by Metabase, this section does not apply to you, and the label will be taken care of by your reviewer.

> **Warning**
>
> If that is your first contribution to Metabase, please sign the [Contributor License Agreement](https://docs.google.com/a/metabase.com/forms/d/1oV38o7b9ONFSwuzwmERRMi9SYrhYeOrkbmNaq9pOJ_E/viewform) (unless it's a tiny documentation change). Also, if you're attempting to fix a translation issue, please submit your changes to our [POEditor project](https://poeditor.com/join/project/ynjQmwSsGh) instead of opening a PR.

Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/[issue_number]

### Description

Describe the overall approach and the problem being solved.

### How to verify

Describe the steps to verify that the changes are working as expected.

1. New question -> Sample Dataset -> ...
2. ...

### Demo

_Upload a demo video or before/after screenshots if sensible or remove the section_

### Checklist

- [ ] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Implement dashboard subscription using dummy tools
body:
Fixes #50879 

### Description

Implements dashboard subscription for the current user to the currently visible dashboard. Assumes a generic context provided by the FE describing the objects currently visible to the user. (For testing purposes, If the FE provides no context, it puts dashboard 14 into the context.)

title: fix(sdk): update define function names in Next.js compat
body: We renamed the type helper functions to `defineMetabaseTheme` and `defineMetabaseAuthConfig` in https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/50585. This PR updates the compat generation script to use the same naming.

title: docs(sdk): simpler documentation for building the sdk locally
body:
This pr fixes some issues we had in the dev docs + adds new parts about common errors.

It also removes the sdk dev docs from the docs website to keep them "internal" for the moment as discussed yesterday in the weekly
author: npretto
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Embedding', '')]
comments_list:
[{'comment_id': 2528905658, 'issue_id': 2727846810, 'author': 'github-actions[bot]', 'body': '<!---conventional commit reminder comment ID-->
@npretto You have modified embedding SDK code. Please make sure the PR title follows [Conventional Commits](https://www.conventionalcommits.org/en/v1.0.0/) style.
Here are all the supported types that will be shown in the changelog:
- `feat`
- `fix`
- `perf`

These types `docs`, `style`, `refactor`, `test`, `build`, and `ci` are also encouraged for non-changelog related tasks.

Please also make sure to include `sdk` scope, otherwise, the changelog will not include this task.

For example, these are valid PR titles:
- `feat(sdk): Add interactive dashboard component`
- `feat(sdk): Support theming pie chart`
- `fix(sdk): Fix static dashboard crash`', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 12, 9, 17, 52, 23, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2531206019, 'issue_id': 2727846810, 'author': 'trunk-io[bot]', 'body': '<!-- Trunk Test Analytics -->

github-actions[bot] on (2024-12-09 17:52:23 UTC): <!---conventional commit reminder comment ID-->
@npretto You have modified embedding SDK code. Please make sure the PR title follows [Conventional Commits](https://www.conventionalcommits.org/en/v1.0.0/) style.
Here are all the supported types that will be shown in the changelog:
- `feat`
- `fix`
- `perf`

These types `docs`, `style`, `refactor`, `test`, `build`, and `ci` are also encouraged for non-changelog related tasks.

Please also make sure to include `sdk` scope, otherwise, the changelog will not include this task.

For example, these are valid PR titles:
- `feat(sdk): Add interactive dashboard component`
- `feat(sdk): Support theming pie chart`
- `fix(sdk): Fix static dashboard crash`

title: feat(sdk): make editable dashboard grid border color themeable
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/47567

### Description

Updates the editable dashboard's dashboard grid border color to be themeable.

Dashboard grid colors will use the border color in `colors.border` by default, and allows overriding with `components.dashboard.gridBorderColor` if you want the grid color to differ than other border colors (useful because in some themes you want the grid border to be less noticeable)

### How to verify

- Go to the `EditableDashboard` folder in Storybook.
- Check out the "Dark Theme" story and click on edit. The border color should now come from `color.borders` from the story.
- Check out the "Custom Grid Color" story and click on edit. The border color should now come from `components.dashboard.gridBorderColor` from the story.
author: heypoom
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Embedding', ''), ('Embedding/SDK', 'Embedding SDK for React')]

title: Avoid logging stacktrace in streaming
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/50992

As per [this](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C0645JP1W81/p1733753867226139) slack discussion, this PR disables logging of stacktrace for the case mentioned in the issue.

title: Port `EntityName` to use RTK Query
body:
Closes #51050

### Description

Reimplements `EntityName` to directly use RTK query to get rid of `EntityObjectLoader` usages.

### How to verify

CI is green.
author: kamilmielnik

title: Port `EntityName` to use RTK Query
body:
Closes #51050

### Description

Reimplements `EntityName` to directly use RTK query to get rid of `EntityObjectLoader` usages.

### How to verify

CI is green.

title: Remove `EntityLink`
body:
Closes #51041

### Description

Removes `EntityLink` & `entity.Link` components to get rid of `EntityObjectLoader` usages.

### How to verify

- Database breadcrumb in `/browse/databases/:id` works
- Link in toast after moving question/model/metric to a different collection works
- Link in toast after moving dashboard to a different collection works

title: adjusting webhook test response ui
body:
Fixes #51114 

### Description
This change makes it so that only non-success responses get a test response section in the webhook form

### How to verify
- Go to an existing webhook (or set up a new one) and provide an valid URL, but that returns a 400 or 500 response.
- hit "Send Test".
- The box with the background should not contain the header, and the padding should be in line with the rest of the form. Also, the response should be scrollable.
- Replace with a valid url and hit send test. Test response should go away

### Checklist
- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Basic Search Index support for h2
body:
Very crude support, using LIKE instead of full text.

I evaluated both the built-in and Lucene extension full text support in h2, but neither produced reasonable ranking. The built-in version did not support completions, so it totally dead in the water for the command palette. Lucene requires adding new dependencies, but could probably improve our filtering.

For now this does no text ranking at all. One idea is to bring back in-memory ranking.

title: [Snyk] Security upgrade @slack/web-api from 6.12.1 to 7.8.0
body:
![snyk-top-banner](https://redirect.github.com/andygongea/OWASP-Benchmark/assets/818805/c518c423-16fe-447e-b67f-ad5a49b5d123) ### Snyk has created this PR to fix 1 vulnerabilities in the yarn dependencies of this project. #### Snyk changed the following file(s): - `release/package.json` - `release/yarn.lock` #### Note for [zero-installs](https://yarnpkg.com/features/zero-installs) users If you are using the Yarn feature [zero-installs](https://yarnpkg.com/features/zero-installs) that was introduced in Yarn V2, note that this PR does not update the `.yarn/cache/` directory meaning this code cannot be pulled and immediately developed on as one would expect for a zero-install project - you will need to run `yarn` to update the contents of the `./yarn/cache` directory. If you are not using zero-install you can ignore this as your flow should likely be unchanged. #### Vulnerabilities that will be fixed with an upgrade: | | Issue | Score | :-------------------------:|:-------------------------|:------------------------- ![medium severity](https://res.cloudinary.com/snyk/image/upload/w_20,h_20/v1561977819/icon/m.png 'medium severity') | Cross-site Scripting (XSS)
[SNYK-JS-AXIOS-6671926](https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JS-AXIOS-6671926) |   **551**   --- > [!IMPORTANT] > > - Check the changes in this PR to ensure they won't cause issues with your project. > - Max score is 1000. Note that the real score may have changed since the PR was raised. > - This PR was automatically created by Snyk using the credentials of a real user. --- **Note:** _You are seeing this because you or someone else with access to this repository has authorized Snyk to open fix PRs._ For more information: ðŸ§ [View latest project report](https://app.snyk.io/org/metabase-AnD9iS4Wfu4eBYMsG2DZ5N/project/6610d131-5ce4-4ce6-8e76-0534cd96981a?utm_source=github&utm_medium=referral&page=fix-pr) ðŸ“œ [Customise PR templates](https://docs.snyk.io/scan-using-snyk/pull-requests/snyk-fix-pull-or-merge-requests/customize-pr-templates?utm_source=github&utm_content=fix-pr-template) ðŸ›  [Adjust project settings](https://app.snyk.io/org/metabase-AnD9iS4Wfu4eBYMsG2DZ5N/project/6610d131-5ce4-4ce6-8e76-0534cd96981a?utm_source=github&utm_medium=referral&page=fix-pr/settings) ðŸ“š [Read about Snyk's upgrade logic](https://docs.snyk.io/scan-with-snyk/snyk-open-source/manage-vulnerabilities/upgrade-package-versions-to-fix-vulnerabilities?utm_source=github&utm_content=fix-pr-template) --- **Learn how to fix vulnerabilities with free interactive lessons:** ðŸ¦‰ [Cross-site Scripting (XSS)](https://learn.snyk.io/lesson/dom-based-xss/?loc=fix-pr) [//]: # title: Migrate legacy & broken relative date time filters
body:
Epic https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/50238

Previously we generated a complex expression for relative date filters with an offset on the FE. It turned out that the expression was wrong by 1 offset unit, e.g. if the offset was by months, it was wrong by 1 month. To fix the issue we introduced a new `:relative-time-interval` function that served several purposes. It captured the user intent clearly while hiding the implementation details; it also fixed the underlying expression. Here we match the old expression and convert it to a `:relative-time-interval` call, honoring the original user intent. See #46211 and #46438 for details.
author: ranquild
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]

title: perf: Don't compile MBQL query into native query twice
body:
This PR is more of a question of whether the current approach is required. I'm sorry if it is intentional, and there is no way to do it differently.

So, while rendering the results, we compile the MBQL query twice â€“Â once in the normal mode and once with inline parameters. I understand the intent of the inline mode for converting the native query to human-readable SQL. But does it need to happen on every data visualization? Can't it be compiled on-demand when the user actually requests the SQL?
author: alexander-yakushev
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge')]

[Docs](https://docs.trunk.io/flaky-tests?utm_source=gh-comment) ', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 12, 8, 20, 8, 46, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2528637206, 'issue_id': 2725492711, 'author': 'alexander-yakushev', 'body': 'This test fails here, unsurprisingly: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/master/test/metabase/query_processor/execute_test.clj#L7 Is it obligatory for the regular query execution to always produce the inline native form? Can the test be rewritten to ask for rerun the query with inlining?', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 12, 9, 16, 38, 37, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2540074409, 'issue_id': 2725492711, 'author': 'bshepherdson', 'body': "> Is it obligatory for the regular query execution to always produce the inline native form? Can the test be rewritten to ask for rerun the query with inlining? AFAIK, the `:native_form` on the metadata finds its way directly to the API response for a query execution. I think that's the only place where we consume the inlined form. That feels like it could, say, become a `defer` that only gets `deref`'d on its way onto the wire. We preprocess and compile queries that weren't coming directly from the user. (@camsaul in case there's some deeper reason I'm not seeing.)", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 12, 12, 21, 45, 1, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2551985941, 'issue_id': 2725492711, 'author': 'camsaul', 'body': "You are technically correct that we don't need to compile the query an extra time with inlined parameters, but we'd have to rework the frontend code as well to fetch the SQL on demand from a different API endpoint instead of getting it from the existing query response endpoint. So we'd have to get a FE person to help out with that. What's the rough performance difference by not doing the extra compilation? If we're saving a millisecond it's not a big difference when query endpoint runtime is dominated by the time it actually takes to run a query anyway", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 12, 18, 18, 18, 31, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2552178974, 'issue_id': 2725492711, 'author': 'alexander-yakushev', 'body': "Got you, thanks. I assumed that the native form is obtained through a separate endpoint already, and this would be a simple change to integrate. Given that it is not the case, it's probably not worth it. Regarding the timings, I stumbled upon this duplicate query compilation when I was investigating https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/33498. The queries there end up being monstrous in size, and it takes up to 1 second to compile them once. So for degenerate cases like that one the optimization would matter, but for ordinary queries it's not that important.", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 12, 18, 20, 10, 24, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2552643663, 'issue_id': 2725492711, 'author': 'camsaul', 'body': "We can probably make it smarter and only preprocess it once and then do the compilation of the preprocessed query twice (once with inlined parameters and once without), right now IIRC it's doing the entire QP pipeline (including preprocessing) twice", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 12, 19, 2, 28, 30, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2583620141, 'issue_id': 2725492711, 'author': 'alexander-yakushev', 'body': 'Closing this as not worth the complication over the benefit in an average case.', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2025, 1, 10, 19, 1, 49, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]
