| | native-form-test | The expected native form does not match the actual one, which is not inlined with parameters. | [LogsÂ â†—ï¸Ž](https://app.trunk.io/metabase/flaky-tests/pr/51024?repo=metabase/metabase&commitHash=3ce6b9b80f30348fd62645314c6074b349ec021b&utm_source=gh-comment&runConclusion=FAILURE&runId=b3ee0ca5-e656-5a7f-92c5-1b4847533749) | | native-form-test | The expected native form does not match the actual one, which is not inlined with parameters. | | [... and 16 more](https://app.trunk.io/metabase/flaky-tests/pr/51024?repo=metabase/metabase&commitHash=3ce6b9b80f30348fd62645314c6074b349ec021b&utm_source=gh-comment&runConclusion=FAILURE) [View Full Report â†—ï¸Ž](https://app.trunk.io/metabase/flaky-tests/pr/51024?repo=metabase/metabase&commitHash=3ce6b9b80f30348fd62645314c6074b349ec021b&utm_source=gh-comment) â‹… [Docs](https://docs.trunk.io/flaky-tests?utm_source=gh-comment) alexander-yakushev (Issue Creator) on (2024-12-09 16:38:37 UTC): This test fails here, unsurprisingly: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/master/test/metabase/query_processor/execute_test.clj#L7 Is it obligatory for the regular query execution to always produce the inline native form? Can the test be rewritten to ask for rerun the query with inlining? bshepherdson on (2024-12-12 21:45:01 UTC): AFAIK, the `:native_form` on the metadata finds its way directly to the API response for a query execution. I think that's the only place where we consume the inlined form. That feels like it could, say, become a `defer` that only gets `deref`'d on its way onto the wire. We preprocess and compile queries that weren't coming directly from the user. (@camsaul in case there's some deeper reason I'm not seeing.) camsaul on (2024-12-18 18:18:31 UTC): You are technically correct that we don't need to compile the query an extra time with inlined parameters, but we'd have to rework the frontend code as well to fetch the SQL on demand from a different API endpoint instead of getting it from the existing query response endpoint. So we'd have to get a FE person to help out with that. What's the rough performance difference by not doing the extra compilation? If we're saving a millisecond it's not a big difference when query endpoint runtime is dominated by the time it actually takes to run a query anyway alexander-yakushev (Issue Creator) on (2024-12-18 20:10:24 UTC): Got you, thanks. I assumed that the native form is obtained through a separate endpoint already, and this would be a simple change to integrate. Given that it is not the case, it's probably not worth it. Regarding the timings, I stumbled upon this duplicate query compilation when I was investigating https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/33498. The queries there end up being monstrous in size, and it takes up to 1 second to compile them once. So for degenerate cases like that one the optimization would matter, but for ordinary queries it's not that important. camsaul on (2024-12-19 02:28:30 UTC): We can probably make it smarter and only preprocess it once and then do the compilation of the preprocessed query twice (once with inlined parameters and once without), right now IIRC it's doing the entire QP pipeline (including preprocessing) twice alexander-yakushev (Issue Creator) on (2025-01-10 19:01:49 UTC): Closing this as not worth the complication over the benefit in an average case.

title: perf: Make registered? and initialized? checks faster for already initialized drivers
body:
The functions affected turn out to be quite hot when the query processor is working. This PR does 3 things:

1. Makes `initialized?` faster by hiding the initialization of parent drivers behind the initialization of child driver. The logic is this: initializing a driver requires first initializing its parents. So, if the child driver is marked as initialized, then parents are surely initialized too.
2. Makes `the-initialized-driver` check if the driver is already `initialized?`, and only otherwise it proceeds to register and initialize it. This is done because `registered?` predicate is comparatively expensive, performing lookups in the hierarchy. And `isa?` is sloppy peformance-wise in general.
3. Buries the initialization of the classloader into a place where we really start loading stuff. This is less important after **2*.* but still makes sense to do it like this. The current access of the classloader (in fact, replacing it inside) looks out of place here.
author: alexander-yakushev
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge')]

[Docs](https://docs.trunk.io/flaky-tests?utm_source=gh-comment) alexander-yakushev (Issue Creator) on (2024-12-09 16:29:12 UTC): @camsaul, this is probably a question to you: this test is failing https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/master/test/metabase/driver_test.clj#L35 which checks that `the-driver` always sets the shared-classloader. Does it have to work like that always? I assumed that setting the classloader is only important if we load namespaces (the first time before the driver is registered), but perhaps I'm missing a bigger picture? camsaul on (2024-12-09 18:38:17 UTC): Yeah setting the classloader is really only important if we're loading the namespaces. We don't actually need to set it if the driver is already loaded alexander-yakushev (Issue Creator) on (2024-12-09 22:45:42 UTC): I've rewritten the test to simulate a yet unregistered driver. alexander-yakushev (Issue Creator) on (2024-12-10 08:11:50 UTC): @lbrdnk Hi, I discovered that you are are the author of the databricks driver. Could you help me here please? Do you maybe have some ideas why these changes might break the databricks driver but nothing else? dpsutton on (2025-01-15 15:16:11 UTC): I suspect it is because this driver is loaded from a jar at runtime on a special classloader. We have to ensure that any thread which tries to use the databricks driver (jetty threads, etc) can see it.

title: Bump Malli to 0.17.0
body:
This version contains two performance improvements that impact the performance of data rendering:
- https://github.com/metosin/malli/pull/1105
- https://github.com/metosin/malli/pull/1104

Here are all the supported types that will be shown in the changelog: - `feat` - `fix` - `perf` These types `docs`, `style`, `refactor`, `test`, `build`, and `ci` are also encouraged for non-changelog related tasks. Please also make sure to include `sdk` scope, otherwise, the changelog will not include this task. ### Description

This adds new UX for notifications setup (alerts, subscriptions, pulse).

### How to verify

title: Migrate legacy exclude date filters on read
body:
Epic https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/50238
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/50920
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/50958

Replaces legacy **exclude** date filters based on temporal bucketing (`:temporal-unit`) with function calls (`:temporal-extract`) via `normalize`.

title: Prevent newly opened items from expanding outside viewport
body:
### What does this PR accomplish?
Fixes #51006 by scrolling the newly opened accordion item into view.

The mechanism how/why this was happening can be found in the original issue.

> [!NOTE]
> I wanted to add an E2E test for this, but (1) it would conflict with #50536 (which is higher priority anyway), and (2) I couldn't write the test without having to introduce an arbitrary wait. If it's really important, I can find the solution for it in a follow-up PR.

### Demo
https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5a8beafc-019c-42ac-98c8-efeada7afcf0
author: nemanjaglumac
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge')]

title: Pin webhook tester to v1
body:
Our webhook testing docker container just moved to v2 which had some breaking changes which broke some of our e2e tests

https://github.com/tarampampam/webhook-tester/releases/tag/v2.0.0

Lesson: always use a version tag on docker containers like this.

This pins CI to the version 1.1 so it continues to work consistently
author: iethree
labels: [('.CI & Tests', ''), ('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: fix: add supports for xx-YY locales in embed/public-links and sdk
body:
Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/51039


This PR will be backported up to 51 to support the sdk, I made [another PR](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/51456) which verify that this is working also for public/static embed, that PR will be only backported to 52 as that's the version where #locale was added (see https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/50182)


# Changes

This PR replicates on the FE the "fallback logic" for the locale that is already in place for the backend, see [the tests](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/51002/files#r1884230079) to see exactly what the logic does.
It uses the `available-locales` settings as source of data, as we always have that data already loaded:
- in public/static it's injected by the server in the html when the page loads
- in the sdk we load the instance properties during the auth flow

title: fix(sdk): Fix alignment of ColorSelector in SDK Chart Settings
body: Fixes the ColorSelector in the `QuestionSettings` component of the SDK by converting the color selector's popover component to a Mantine popover. For whatever reason, the width of the ColorSelectorPopover reverts to a 1x32 (or however many colors there are) in the SDK, but with the Mantine popover it keeps its shape. No tests and no styles have changed. The best way to test it is to make sure it is very much the same experience in the visualization settings for a question. Before: After:

title: Convert ChartSettingSegmentedControl to Mantine
body: Converts the `ChartSettingSegmentedControl` from the legacy `SegmentedControl` component to the Mantine `SegmentedControl` component. All tests should continue to pass as nothing fundamental has changed. Visual changes are: Before: After: This one here is the only difference - the buttons are evenly sized in the new version. --- Another - before: After:
author: oisincoveney

title: Make Loki's embedding scroll stories more resilient
body:
Reported [on Slack](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C063Q3F1HPF/p1733417902850549), [example failure](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/12163691229/job/33984446227?pr=50792)

### Description.

I previously wait for 300ms before scroll the embed container, it seems this isn't enough in some cases on CI. So, the fix should be to try to attempt this until it succeed.

### How to verify

The Loki visual regression CI check should pass


### Checklist

- [] ~Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR~ tests already covered by Loki
author: WiNloSt
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Embedding', '')]

title: Fix race between jobs accessing the search index
body:
Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/50978

TIL that simple jobs run immediately the first time they're scheduled.

title: Improve queue test and add more buffering
body:
refs #50948 

I wasn't able to get the original test to flake locally (running in a loop), but hopefully spacing out the delays more will help.

While I was here I improved the coverage of the test.

I didn't bother making it multi-threaded, as that would introduce even more flake potential.

title: Convert ChartSettingSelect to Mantine
body: Converts `ChartSettingSelect` to Mantine. On the SDK side, we've had some issues with z-indexes and styles with the `ChartSettingSelect` component when using the chart settings with a popover - the dropdown would appear behind the modal making the setting UI useless. This converts the `ChartSettingSelect` component to a Mantine component which will help us both with theming and with the z-index issues. I needed to fix a bunch of tests to make this work, so tests should pass now. I also needed to convert `ChartSettingsFieldPicker` to fix the same issues, so I made that a `Select` of its own. As you can see below, I am also converting the `ChartSettingOrderedItems` component to Mantine as well so both components will use `Group`, `ActionIcon`, and the same spacing from the mantien style props to ensure that the styles remain consistent across both components. **ChartSettingSelect** Before: After: --- **ChartSettingFieldPicker** Before: After:
author: oisincoveney
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Embedding', '')]

title: feat(sdk): Interactive Question Chart Settings Dropdown
body:
Adds a `QuestionSettingsDropdown` component to the default interactive question layout to allow users to make changes to their visualizations on the fly. 

If you would like to see this for yourself:
- Check out this branch
- Run `yarn run embedding-sdk:dev`
- Run `yarn run storybook-embedding-sdk` in a different session
- Go to [http://localhost:6006/?path=/story/embeddingsdk-interactivequestion--default](http://localhost:6006/?path=/story/embeddingsdk-interactivequestion--default)
- See the cog that should show the chart settings!


Here's a few examples:

Detail

> [!IMPORTANT]
> For those employed by Metabase: if you are merging into master, please add either a `backport` or a `no-backport` label to this PR. You will not be able to merge until you do this step. Refer to the section [Do I need to backport this PR?](https://www.notion.so/metabase/Metabase-Branching-Strategy-6eb577d5f61142aa960a626d6bbdfeb3?pvs=4#89f80d6f17714a0198aeb66c0efd1b71) in the Metabase Branching Strategy document for more details. If you're not employed by Metabase, this section does not apply to you, and the label will be taken care of by your reviewer.

> **Warning**
>
> If that is your first contribution to Metabase, please sign the [Contributor License Agreement](https://docs.google.com/a/metabase.com/forms/d/1oV38o7b9ONFSwuzwmERRMi9SYrhYeOrkbmNaq9pOJ_E/viewform) (unless it's a tiny documentation change). Also, if you're attempting to fix a translation issue, please submit your changes to our [POEditor project](https://poeditor.com/join/project/ynjQmwSsGh) instead of opening a PR.

Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/[issue_number]

title: Fix the value names of the pivot table are not set in XLSX pivot export
body:
Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/49605

The value name of the pivot table was fixed with `DataConsolidateFunction/SUM` before, now it has been changed to be dynamic. If a custom name(`column title`) has been set, the custom name will be used; otherwise, the default column name (`display_name`) will be adopted.

eg:
![eg](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/68295012-99d5-4569-98ea-9bb5f62ce1b1)
before:
![before](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7e5dd446-ab88-4605-b16e-f1606281b276)
now:
![now](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e798b9ba-48bc-4095-ae11-1e84a6af50d1)
author: givemesomefaces

title: Test that we can go back from the notebook editor
body: This PR builds on #50420 by adding an e2e test that the user can press the back button to return from the notebook editor to the homepage. Previously this was impossible due to a pop-under bug (#50971).

title: Fix the zoom-in.timeseries drill for multi-stage queries
body:
### Description

If no dimensions are provided to the zoom-in.timeseries drill, then attempt to find the matching dimension from the FE-provided row data instead, if present.

Related to https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/46932

### How to verify

- New question: Orders
- summarize: Count by Created At: Month
- Add filter stage after summarize, e.g. Count > 1
- Visualize
- Select Table viz
- Click on a cell
- "See this month by week" drill through should appear in the context menu

### Demo


### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Support FE display functions for during function
body:
Fixes #50942

### Description

The generated display name is the same as that of an equality expression on a bucketed temporal column. The generated display names for the date parts are new and are derived from the full display name.

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: If multiple limit or offset arguments are passed, only use the 1st one
body:
### Description

Fixes #45345 based closed PR #48650

Did not end up using Malli as the change was well isolated already and simple

### How to verify

Adding an extra &limit or &offset to a question loads the page and strips off the extra limit/offset like in PR 48650

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cd43d098-5cd8-4618-b835-2a7a8a645ef3)


### Checklist

- [X] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Nested joins ignore temporal units
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/48058

### Description

The underlying issue is that nest-query/nest-expression included temporal units when copying over joined fields into the nested query.  This caused both the nested query and the parent query to include the "extract the unit from the date" code.  In cases where the extraction didn't change the type, this duplication wasn't a big deal.  However, for temporal units like hour-of-day, the first extraction changed the type of the field from date to string, and then the second extraction broke.

### How to verify

Follow the reproduction instructions in the linked case.  Basically, set up a question with a join, a custom fields, and a summary on a date field from the joined table grouped by hour of day.  This used to not work, and now it does.

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: wzimrin
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]

title: Visualizer data importer prototype search hack
body:
Temporarily add :visualization_settings and :result_metadata to search results for the purposes of validating the proj-visualizer design.

This is a temporary measure and changes should be reverted in favour of a solution that won't require all search
results everywhere to 'carry around' data that's only needed in the visualizer context.

Tests are left failing as a reminder that this is temporary!

Here I just show an example search response now with viz and metadata.
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/162e0fbf-0f7c-432d-9334-7726c832a2eb)

title: Update test to use revert icon
body: We changed the time_history icon in this context to a revert icon in #46050 but never updated this test. This PR fixes that.

body:
Epic https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/50238

Moves `specific-date-filter-parts` to MBQL lib. Currently without behavior changes; the plan is to use `:during` under the hood instead of temporal bucketing in a subsequent PR.

title: Use the time_history icon to display when a question was last updated
body: On master, we use a calendar icon to display when the question was last updated. However the calendar icon is actually already used to represent events: ![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cfe810dd-8caa-4a18-b9ae-ea3d4ae48ca4) This PR introduces a time_history icon, to differentiate this icon from the events icon. Before: After: This PR also fixes the dimensions of the time_history icon.
author: rafpaf
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: Include explicit require to c.t.build.tasks.uber
body:
Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/50940

Build sometimes fails with

```clojure
      Compiling namespaces [metabase.driver.sqlserver]
{:via
 [{:type clojure.lang.ExceptionInfo,
   :message
   "Running build steps for Enterprise Edition version UNKNOWN: version, translations, frontend, licenses, drivers, uberjar",
   :data {},
   :at [metabuild_common.steps$do_step invokeStatic "steps.clj" 90]}
  {:type clojure.lang.ExceptionInfo,
   :message "Building all drivers in parallel (:ee edition)",
   :data {},
   :at [metabuild_common.steps$do_step invokeStatic "steps.clj" 90]}
  {:type java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException,
   :message "clojure.lang.ExceptionInfo: Build driver :databricks (edition = :ee, options = nil) {}",
   :at [java.util.concurrent.FutureTask report "FutureTask.java" 122]}
  {:type clojure.lang.ExceptionInfo,
   :message "Build driver :databricks (edition = :ee, options = nil)",
   :data {},
   :at [metabuild_common.steps$do_step invokeStatic "steps.clj" 90]}
  {:type clojure.lang.ExceptionInfo,
   :message
   "Write :databricks :ee uberjar -> /home/runner/work/metabase/metabase/resources/modules/databricks.metabase-driver.jar",
   :data {},
   :at [metabuild_common.steps$do_step invokeStatic "steps.clj" 90]}
  {:type java.lang.IllegalStateException,
   :message "Attempting to call unbound fn: #'clojure.tools.build.tasks.uber/uber",
   :at [clojure.lang.Var$Unbound throwArity "Var.java" 47]}],
 :trace
 [[clojure.lang.Var$Unbound throwArity "Var.java" 47]
  [clojure.lang.AFn invoke "AFn.java" 32]
  [clojure.lang.Var invoke "Var.java" 386]
  [clojure.tools.build.api$uber invokeStatic "api.clj" 511]
  [clojure.tools.build.api$uber invoke "api.clj" 439]
  [build_drivers.create_uberjar$create_uberjar_BANG_$fn__4951 invoke "create_uberjar.clj" 82]
  [metabuild_common.steps$do_step invokeStatic "steps.clj" 87]
  [metabuild_common.steps$do_step invoke "steps.clj" 81]
  [build_drivers.create_uberjar$create_uberjar_BANG_ invokeStatic "create_uberjar.clj" 80]
  [build_drivers.create_uberjar$create_uberjar_BANG_ invoke "create_uberjar.clj" 77]
  [build_drivers.build_driver$build_driver_BANG_$fn__6636 invoke "build_driver.clj" 37]
  [metabuild_common.steps$do_step invokeStatic "steps.clj" 87]
  [metabuild_common.steps$do_step invoke "steps.clj" 81]
  [build_drivers.build_driver$build_driver_BANG_ invokeStatic "build_driver.clj" 33]
  [build_drivers.build_driver$build_driver_BANG_ invoke "build_driver.clj" 17]
  [build_drivers.build_driver$build_driver_BANG_ invokeStatic "build_driver.clj" 24]
  [build_drivers.build_driver$build_driver_BANG_ invoke "build_driver.clj" 17]
  [build_drivers$build_drivers_BANG_$fn__6657$fn__6658 invoke "build_drivers.clj" 31]
  [clojure.core$pmap$fn__8582$fn__8583 invoke "core.clj" 7169]
  [clojure.core$binding_conveyor_fn$fn__5842 invoke "core.clj" 2047]
  [clojure.lang.AFn call "AFn.java" 18]
  [java.util.concurrent.FutureTask run "FutureTask.java" 264]
  [java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor runWorker "ThreadPoolExecutor.java" 1128]
  [java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker run "ThreadPoolExecutor.java" 628]
  [java.lang.Thread run "Thread.java" 829]],
 :cause "Attempting to call unbound fn: #'clojure.tools.build.tasks.uber/uber"}
```

Seems that pmap-ing over the tasks hits a race condition with how the api works

```clojure
(defn uber
  [params]
  (assert-required "uber" params [:class-dir :uber-file])
  (assert-specs "uber" params
    :class-dir ::specs/path
    :uber-file ::specs/path)
  ((requiring-resolve 'clojure.tools.build.tasks.uber/uber) params))
```

So we just require `clojure.tools.build.tasks.uber` so that the namespace is compiled and ready.
author: dpsutton
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge')]

title: Fix edge cases in New Search around model filtering
body:
- We were incorrectly filtering out some models for restricted users.
- We were not filtering by models in the case where none were viable for our filters.

Found both of these while porting over the integration tests, but want to bring these fixes in separately so that its safe to backport.
author: crisptrutski
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

title: Replace Actions API handlers in entities with RTK Query
body:
Closes #50873

### Description

We missed this before, it should have been done in Milestone 1 in https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/40788.

This PR also enables the new `EntityObjectLoaderRtkQuery` for Actions (that's why it's not going to be backported).

### How to verify

CI is green.
author: kamilmielnik
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]

title: Move alerts and pulse components to notifications domain
body:
Part of https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/50766

### Description

This moves alerts and subscriptions related files to a separate folder (domain) "notifications". This is preparation for a major refactoring in this area in scope of https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/50766

### How to verify

CI should pass

title: Remove query hooks from hooks/entity-framework
body:
Closes #50926

### Description

Removes all `use-xyz-query` hooks from `hooks/entity-framework`.
`use-xyz-list-query` hooks will be removed separately.

### How to verify

CI is green.

title: [Notification] CRUD notification APIs
body:
Add 2 APIs:
- POST /api/notification
- PUT /api/notification/:id
  - Can also update/insert/delete all its sub-resources: card_notification, subscriptions, handlers, handler recipients


Examples


**Create an alert:**

- send once if above goal
- has 1 cron schedule
- has 2 handlers that use default template
    - to webhook channel
    - to email channel
        - send to one internal user, one external user

Make a POST request  to `/api/notification`
```json
{
	"payload_type": "notification/card",
	"active": true,
	"creator_id": 3,
	"payload": {
		"card_id": 2,
		"send_condition": "goal_above",
		"send_once": true
	},
	"subscriptions": [{
		"type": "notification-subscription/cron",
		"cron_schedule": "0 0 0 * * ?"
	}],
	"handlers": [{
			"channel_type": "channel/http",
			"channel_id": 1
		},
		{
			"channel_type": "channel/email",
			"recipients": [{
					"type": "notification-recipient/user",
					"user_id": 3
				},
				{
					"type": "notification-recipient/raw-value",
					"details": {
						"value": "ngoc@metabase.com"
					}
				}
			]
		}
	]
}
```

This endpoint will return a fully hydrated notification.

```json
{
  "payload_id": 72,
  "payload": {
    "id": 72,
    "card_id": 2,
    "send_once": true,
    "send_condition": "goal_above"
  },
  "creator": {
    "email": "crowberto@metabase.com",
    "first_name": "Crowberto",
    "last_login": null,
    "is_qbnewb": true,
    "is_superuser": true,
    "id": 3,
    "last_name": "Corv",
    "date_joined": "2024-12-05T04:57:26.47935Z",
    "common_name": "Crowberto Corv"
  },
  "payload_type": "notification/card",
  "handlers": [
    {
      "template_id": null,
      "channel_type": "channel/metabase-test",
      "channel": {
        "id": 3,
        "name": "Test channel",
        "description": "Test channel description",
        "type": "channel/http",
        "active": true
      },
      "template": null,
      "recipients": [
        {
          "type": "notification-recipient/user",
          "permissions_group_id": null,
          "details": null,
          "id": 82,
          "user_id": 3,
          "notification_handler_id": 129,
          "user": {
            "email": "crowberto@metabase.com",
            "first_name": "Crowberto",
            "last_login": null,
            "is_qbnewb": true,
            "is_superuser": true,
            "id": 3,
            "last_name": "Corv",
            "date_joined": "2024-12-05T04:57:26.47935Z",
            "common_name": "Crowberto Corv"
          }
        }
      ],
      "channel_id": 3,
      "notification_id": 72,
      "active": true,
      "id": 129
    },
    {
      "template_id": null,
      "channel_type": "channel/email",
      "channel": null,
      "template": null,
      "recipients": [
        {
          "type": "notification-recipient/user",
          "permissions_group_id": null,
          "details": null,
          "id": 83,
          "user_id": 3,
          "notification_handler_id": 130,
          "user": {
            "email": "crowberto@metabase.com",
            "first_name": "Crowberto",
            "last_login": null,
            "is_qbnewb": true,
            "is_superuser": true,
            "id": 3,
            "last_name": "Corv",
            "date_joined": "2024-12-05T04:57:26.47935Z",
            "common_name": "Crowberto Corv"
          }
        }
      ],
      "channel_id": null,
      "notification_id": 72,
      "active": true,
      "id": 130
    }
  ],
  "creator_id": 3,
  "subscriptions": [
    {
      "id": 125,
      "notification_id": 72,
      "type": "notification-subscription/cron",
      "event_name": null,
      "cron_schedule": "0 0 0 * * ?"
    }
  ],
  "active": true,
  "id": 72
}

```

**Update alert**
- delete the HTTP handler
- add a slack handler that sends to #general
```diff
{
  "payload_id": 72,
  "payload": {
    "id": 72,
    "card_id": 2,
    "send_once": true,
    "send_condition": "goal_above"
  },
  "creator": {
    "email": "crowberto@metabase.com",
    "first_name": "Crowberto",
    "last_login": null,
    "is_qbnewb": true,
    "is_superuser": true,
    "id": 3,
    "last_name": "Corv",
    "date_joined": "2024-12-05T04:57:26.47935Z",
    "common_name": "Crowberto Corv"
  },
  "payload_type": "notification/card",
  "handlers": [
-    {
-      "template_id": null,
-      "channel_type": "channel/http",
-      "channel": {
-        "id": 3,
-        "name": "Test channel",
-        "description": "Test channel description",
-        "type": "channel/http",
-        "active": true
-      },
-      "template": null,
-      "recipients": [
-        {
-          "type": "notification-recipient/user",
-          "permissions_group_id": null,
-          "details": null,
-          "id": 82,
-          "user_id": 3,
-          "notification_handler_id": 129,
-          "user": {
-            "email": "crowberto@metabase.com",
-            "first_name": "Crowberto",
-            "last_login": null,
-            "is_qbnewb": true,
-            "is_superuser": true,
-            "id": 3,
-            "last_name": "Corv",
-            "date_joined": "2024-12-05T04:57:26.47935Z",
-            "common_name": "Crowberto Corv"
-          }
-        }
-      ],
-      "channel_id": 3,
-      "notification_id": 72,
-      "active": true,
-      "id": 129
-    },
+    {
+      "id": -1,
+		"channel_type": "channel/slack",
+		"recipients": [{
+			"type": "notification-recipient/raw-value",
+			"details": {"value": "#general"}
+		}]
+	 },
    {
      "template_id": null,
      "channel_type": "channel/email",
      "channel": null,
      "template": null,
      "recipients": [
        {
          "type": "notification-recipient/user",
          "permissions_group_id": null,
          "details": null,
          "id": 83,
          "user_id": 3,
          "notification_handler_id": 130,
          "user": {
            "email": "crowberto@metabase.com",
            "first_name": "Crowberto",
            "last_login": null,
            "is_qbnewb": true,
            "is_superuser": true,
            "id": 3,
            "last_name": "Corv",
            "date_joined": "2024-12-05T04:57:26.47935Z",
            "common_name": "Crowberto Corv"
          }
        }
      ],
      "channel_id": null,
      "notification_id": 72,
      "active": true,
      "id": 130
    }
  ],
  "creator_id": 3,
  "subscriptions": [
    {
      "id": 125,
      "notification_id": 72,
      "type": "notification-subscription/cron",
      "event_name": null,
      "cron_schedule": "0 0 0 * * ?"
    }
  ],
  "active": true,
  "id": 72
}


```

title: [postgres] fix: Quote symbols in `current-user-table-privileges`
body:
Hi there. First things first, thanks a stack for conceiving and maintaining Metabase. This is our first contribution, so we are humbly asking for guidance on all matters.

### Problem
Users of CrateDB, that is roughly compatible with PostgreSQL, started reporting problems connecting with Metabase v0.50. Based on a few investigations, we think the problem may have appeared with Metabase v0.48.4 already.

- https://github.com/crate/crate-clients-tools/issues/153
- https://community.cratedb.com/t/problem-connecting-with-metabase/1919

### Solution
Some databases that are largely compatible with PostgreSQL have subtle dialect differences. Here, it is just about properly quoting special symbol names like `role`, `schema`, `table` that may be reserved symbols in other databases. In this case, it is about CrateDB.

### How to verify
When using a PostgreSQL connection profile, but connecting to a CrateDB instance instead.
```shell
docker run --rm -it --name=cratedb --publish=4200:4200 --publish=5432:5432 \
  --env=CRATE_HEAP_SIZE=2g crate/crate:nightly -Cdiscovery.type=single-node
```

### Errors
```python
SQLParseException[line 5:17: no viable alternative at input 'select\nNULL as role,\nt.schemaname as schema,\nt.objectname as table']
```
```log
metabase  | 2024-11-23 17:06:13,684 WARN sync.util :: Error in sync step Sync postgres Database 2 'cratedb-testdrive'
metabase  | 2024-11-23 17:07:00,031 ERROR core.JobRunShell :: Job DEFAULT.metabase.task.sync-and-analyze.job threw an unhandled Exception:
metabase  | org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: line 5:20: no viable alternative at input 'select\n   NULL as role,\n   t.schemaname as schema,\n   t.objectname as table'
```

### Checklist

- [ ] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: amotl
comments_list: [{'comment_id': 2519018954, 'issue_id': 2719186722, 'author': 'amotl', 'body': 'I just found CrateDB does not provide `pg_catalog.has_any_column_privilege()` either, see https://github.com/crate/crate-clients-tools/issues/153#issuecomment-2519015052, so this patch will not help in our case, to re-enable support for CrateDB via PostgreSQL.\r\n\r\nIn this spirit, I guess it will be safe to close this PR again. Let me know if you would still like to have it.', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 12, 5, 3, 38, 50, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]
comment_thread:
amotl (Issue Creator) on (2024-12-05 03:38:50 UTC): I just found CrateDB does not provide `pg_catalog.has_any_column_privilege()` either, see https://github.com/crate/crate-clients-tools/issues/153#issuecomment-2519015052, so this patch will not help in our case, to re-enable support for CrateDB via PostgreSQL.

In this spirit, I guess it will be safe to close this PR again. Let me know if you would still like to have it.

title: Make postgres enums not error when using :is-empty/:not-empty
body:
> [!IMPORTANT]
> For those employed by Metabase: if you are merging into master, please add either a `backport` or a `no-backport` label to this PR. You will not be able to merge until you do this step. Refer to the section [Do I need to backport this PR?](https://www.notion.so/metabase/Metabase-Branching-Strategy-6eb577d5f61142aa960a626d6bbdfeb3?pvs=4#89f80d6f17714a0198aeb66c0efd1b71) in the Metabase Branching Strategy document for more details. If you're not employed by Metabase, this section does not apply to you, and the label will be taken care of by your reviewer.

> **Warning**
>
> If that is your first contribution to Metabase, please sign the [Contributor License Agreement](https://docs.google.com/a/metabase.com/forms/d/1oV38o7b9ONFSwuzwmERRMi9SYrhYeOrkbmNaq9pOJ_E/viewform) (unless it's a tiny documentation change). Also, if you're attempting to fix a translation issue, please submit your changes to our [POEditor project](https://poeditor.com/join/project/ynjQmwSsGh) instead of opening a PR.

Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/48022

### Description

The problem was that postgres enums were classified as a subtype of text, and so :is-empty was being desugared to a check against both null and ''.  However, '' is generally not a valid value for an enum, so the resulting query was erroring.  By changing postgres enums to be a subtype of textlike instead, the desugar code no longer thinks they are emptyable and doesn't generate the '' branch.

### How to verify

Hook up metabase to a postgres db, create a table with an enum column, and try to filter it with is-empty or not-empty

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: wzimrin
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]

title: Add basic auth on druid JDBC driver
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/45728

### Description

Add basic auth capabilities to Druid JDBC.

### How to verify

Describe the steps to verify that the changes are working as expected.

1. Databases -> Add Database -> Database type -> Druid JDBC
2. Fill host data
3. Show advanced options -> Enable flag "Authentication"
4. Fill basic auth credentials

Note: A Druid database with basic authentication enabled is required to perform the full connection test. Ref: [druid-basic-security](https://druid.apache.org/docs/latest/development/extensions-core/druid-basic-security/)

### Demo

- Database properties, basic auth enabled

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2516fab0-4e92-41af-9bb8-d6e2eaf8b2e7)

- Database properties, basic auth enabled with data

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b17a0cd5-8228-420f-9b96-a21cacf47060)

### Checklist

- [ ] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: ddowbnac

title: fix scatter chart tooltip
body: Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/50630 ### Description Scatter charts display unaggregated data which means each series can have multiple values for a single x-axis value. In case of breakouts (2 dimensions) each bubble represents a single row of ones with a given breakout value: There are multiple rows for `x = Q2 2022` and various breakout values so the series comparison tooltip does not make sense and in this case it showed just empty values: This PR hides other breakout series from the tooltip on scatter charts. In addition to that, since the data is not aggregated it also makes sense to allow adding categorical columns to tooltips like "Product -> Category" here:
author: alxnddr
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/DashViz', 'Dashboard and Viz team')]

title: [FE] Move exclude date filter parts to MBQL lib
body:
Epic https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/50238

Follow up for:
- https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/50752
- https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/50765

Changes:
- Moves `extract-date-filter-parts` and `-clause` to MBQL lib.
- Legacy exclude date filter parsing is left on the FE which should be removed completely when this clause is migrated on card read/select in https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/50920.
author: ranquild
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]

title: [Cmd Palette] Do not show admin and settings links to users who do not have access
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/49729

### Description

The above issue points out that users who are not admins were seeing settings links when they did not have access to the settings pages. This PR fixes that, so that only users with proper permissions to see those pages will have the appropriate options shown to them. This change also takes into account our advanced permissions which permits non-admin to make changes to a subset of our settings page.

### How to verify

Without advanced permissions:
- Sign in as a non-admin
- Open the command palette and type "settings"
- You should see no admin settings links

With advanced permissions:
- Sign in as admin
- Go to permissions page and select "Application" tab
- Give all users access to settings
- Sign out then sign in as a non-admin
- Open the command palette and type "settings"
- You should see some settings pages but not all (General settings should be available, but Setup settings should not be)

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: sloansparger

title: feat(sdk): add initial tab prop for sdk dashboards
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/50559

### Description

Adds the `initialTab` prop to be consistent with static and public embeds, as we are able to pass in `tab` search params to define the initial tab.

### How to verify

- Pass `initialTab` to static or interactive dashboards

### Demo

_Upload a demo video or before/after screenshots if sensible or remove the section_

### Checklist

- [ ] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: heypoom
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Embedding', ''), ('Embedding/SDK', 'Embedding SDK for React')]

title: feat(sdk): use public-facing question type in event handlers
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/50487, Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/50505

### Description

Introduces the public-facing `MetabaseQuestion` type with transforms, and updates the existing event handlers to use the public metabase question type.

### How to verify

- Renders the Question and click on "Save"
- The `onSave` and `onBeforeSave` handlers should now give you the `MetabaseQuestion` type, instead of the internal type.

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR - Unit and E2E
author: heypoom
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Embedding', ''), ('Embedding/SDK', 'Embedding SDK for React')]

title: feat(sdk): use metabase type prefix and re-export types
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/50396, Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/50567

### Description

Renames the type prefixes from `Sdk` to `Metabase` and expose the component types without prefixes.

Note that the `MetabaseAuthConfig` types and `define` methods are out-of-scope of this PR, as it is implemented in https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/50585 instead.
author: heypoom
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Embedding', ''), ('Embedding/SDK', 'Embedding SDK for React')]

title: Convert HomeLayout to Mantine components
body:
Converts the `HomeLayout` to use Mantine components. I had this in my local codebase for a while and I figured it might be good to actually put it up. I'm not sure how I feel about the amount of inline styling that's here but I prefer to use it with the Mantine components over having styled components, in the name of consistency with our styling goals and being able to see all of the styles within our code without using style tags.

Nothing should change here, it's just a 1-1 recreation of the same page.
author: oisincoveney
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Embedding', '')]

title: Enable bug reporting
body:
Closes: 

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/49585
https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/49586
https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/49664
https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/50273
https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/50732

### Description

Since the feedback loop on the new bug reporting modal got real messy real fast, I decided to group all the changes under one branch. This PR contains changes from following PRs:

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/50740
https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/50733
https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/50306
https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/50277
https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/49954

# Main features
ability to open diagnostic window [using Profile settings menu and command palette](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/50856/commits/19427d4bf2ad2ffdc7aef88456de948491866506):
![Screenshot 2024-12-04 at 11 42 48](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b300f4cf-7751-4921-9fc6-ae45610c5058)
![Screenshot 2024-12-04 at 11 48 17](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7caef175-acda-4363-a085-3b1a6bc5a449)

[Rewrite of the Diagnostic modal](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/50856/commits/c3e99f66c51e6492e3214f6dc3a8b685a4b77fdb), splitting it into two new components. One for downloading diagnostic data as we know it (with a facelift) and another one for submitting bugs to Slack. In future, weâ€™ll be sending bugs elsewhere. Right now we enable sending them to slack as part of internal testing. Details on the whole project can be [found here](https://www.notion.so/metabase/Make-it-blazingly-fast-for-us-to-reproduce-and-fix-bugs-11f69354c90180418a27cc39714f3047?pvs=4)

![Screenshot 2024-11-20 at 15 10 30](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d7d7259e-8b5f-4653-a9ff-28f04f42e14c)
![Screenshot 2024-11-20 at 15 10 27](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2ffee9e1-3b03-41ad-b4ec-73a796f8d15a)
![Screenshot 2024-11-20 at 15 09 18](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0e60a35e-4b99-4361-a73f-1c9fdc184f02)

[Analytics](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/50856/commits/e8016e92031c3061887214dc55ec1c9aa15a54f2) for whenever diagnostic modal is opened. (cc @iethree I implemented [your suggestions](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/50306#discussion_r1868300141))

[Collecting basic browser and os information](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/50856/commits/120f44cfa2b2ce1952a20b0655ac3c94e2852059) into diagnostics.

[Ability to jump from slack report message](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/50856/commits/dd670685bccf06101befe934e2ddc11341a37496) right into debugger

### How to verify

1. Press cmd + k to open command palette and search for "file a bug" or use cmd + f1 to open the diagnostic command directly. 
2. download diagnostic data (now contains browser informarion
3. to enable bug reporting to slack, make sure to run your metabase instance with `MB_ENABLE_BUG_REPORTING` env var set to true
4. in slack, click "Jump to debugger"

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Replace experimental flag with engine choice
body:
Now that we're getting close to releasing the new search code, we want to stabilize the config. At the same time we want to future proof it for additional engines being added in the future.

Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/50778
author: crisptrutski
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

title: Fix embed loader not translated with #locale
body:
Relate to #50182 

### Description

First [reported on Slack](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C063Q3F1HPF/p1733249842094189)

There were 2 problems.

1. The loading string is translated at load time, so it needs to be changed to a function
1. Since LocaleProvider is unblocking, we allow the loader to be rendered before the locale is loaded

I'm backporting this PR because the [feature targets 52](https://www.notion.so/metabase/Support-language-localization-in-static-embedding-0307665e3008435d9bb2b3fff8148d7d).

### How to verify

Create a public link of a question or a dashboard, and ensure they have `#locale=<your_target_locale>` in it. e.g. `#locale=ko` (Korean)

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: WiNloSt
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Embedding', '')]

title: [Backend modularization] `metabase.server.core` and `metabase.request.core` API namespaces; update Kondo
body:
Split the stuff related to Ring request/the current request (used all over the app) into a new `metabase.request` module.  Most of the stuff related to the current request lives here now (such as current limit, offset, and tools like `with-current-user` and `as-admin`). Now other namespaces can use `request/` instead of a mix of random server middleware namespaces, and this simplifies the dependency graph between things a lot.

`metabase.server.core` is the new web server API namespace; most things don't need to use this anymore.

I want to move stuff like `*current-user-id*` into the `metabase.request` module as well but that will be a pretty big refactor so I'll leave that as a follow-on to this project.

This PR required untangling a lot of knots and circular dependencies but I think I'm pretty happy with the progress made here. Still more work to do after this lands, tho.

title: Render negative values on PieChart
body: Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/50692 ### Description After revamping the PieChart we regressed in handling negative values. Based on the previous behavior: - When a dataset includes a mix of positive and negative values we should omit negative values. - When all values are negative we should render a normal pie chart with these values â€” this got broken. ECharts does not support rendering slices with negative values so we have to use absolute values while making sure we display correct negative values in the tooltip. ### How to verify Create a pie chart with all negative values and ensure it looks as expected. ``` select 'foo' x, -100 y union all select 'bar', -100 union all select 'baz', -200 union all select 'qux', -200 ``` ### Demo ### Checklist - [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: New and improved Examples collection
body: We want to ship a new and improved Examples collection. That gets loaded during startup, in a custom migration. We read from a bespoke edn format and load it into the app. We only run this when there is nothing else in the DB, so we can make some simplifying assumptions (e.g. hardcoding ids etc, which serialization handles in a different way.) This edn file has the information needed to populate the new and improved Examples collection contents into the app-db during startup migrations by the `CreateSampleContent` migration. # How to see the content: Start a fresh metabase install, and you should see the Examples collection:
author: escherize
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]
